Front Box Cover

It's a whole new ballgame!

Stunning high resolution, 3-D graphics and exclusive physics-based game play.

28 major league parks including Jacobs Field and Coors Field.

MLBPA-licensed with complete rosters for all teams.

161793.name: La chasse aux pirates
161793.description:
Capture the pirates, find their treasure, and lock them all away in the dungeon.

1. Match the pirates with the same treasure.

2. Find the island where their treasure is buried.

Watch out! If you can't find the right treasure in time, another player could take your pirates.

161796.name: Munchkin Draghetto o Scherzetto

161797.name: Front Page Sports: Baseball Pro '98
161797.description:
User Summary

In Baseball Pro '98 you can manage all aspects of your team. Being the Owner and General Manager, you can hire and fire staff and negotiate contracts. You can also coach your players from their rookie season all the way to he Hall of Fame. Whatever mode you choose to play in, either arcade or full simulation, you will absolutely love this game.

161799.name: Larry and the Gnomes
161799.description:
User Summary

Larry and the Gnomes is a side-scrolling beat 'em up/brawler game. The kingdom of Karryon is threatened by angry gnomes and the king sends Larry is sent to discover what is behind their rebellion. Controls are via keyboard (reassignable), arrow keys to move, space to jump, and five action keys for attack, ranged attack, throw weapon, pickup and rage where Larry releases built-up anger in an energy wave. This accumulates from killing minions. Each levels progresses until a boss is reached.

161801.name: Front Page Sports: Ski Racing
161801.description:
User Summary

A highly realistic skiing simulation in which you can try your skills at Slalom, Giant Slalom, Super Giant Slalom and Downhill in four American and two European courses. Manage your turns, prepare the jumps and perform back flips as well as other tricks. Whether you choose to train in the training mode or compete for points in the season mode, you are bound to have an impressive experience!

161802.name: Munchkin La Rivincita del Babbo

161804.name: PGA Championship Golf 2000
161804.description:
User Summary

In this second installment of the PGA Championship Golf game series you may opt for trying the new "quick start" feature which allows instant getting into the game. Additional novelties include creating your own golfer, competing in the pro tour or the amateur circuit and practicing in the greens and the driving range.

161807.name: Cabela's Big Game Hunter 2012
161807.description:
The game takes place in nine different locations Montana, Mexico, Uruguay, Russia, South Africa, Australia, Texas, Namibia and Alaska. Each location features three different primary days with five different hunts available from the start of the region. In Cabela's Big Game Hunter 2012 animals can see, hear and smell you. The game features a big variety of environments available including lush forests, dry deserts, craggy mountains, flooded plains, scorching savannas and the freezing tundra. The game also features multiple scenarios where "decisions" will have to be made. Each region features a variety of animals each specific to the environments in which can be hunted throughout the game.

The game incorporates many new elements not found in previous main series games, such as having shooting blinds, shooting rests and tree stands, a caller, and other things to aid the player. But other new things are implemented in this game to work against the player. Animals now have an improved and more realistic AI, meaning they could see, smell, or hear you if you make a wrong move. Similar to Dangerous Hunts, predators can randomly surprise the player by jumping out of a bush or off a cliff, and time is slowed down so the player can shoot before it kills you. Getting to your target is now more challenging with the implementation of stealth hunts and timed hunts. Stealth hunts are when the males are not within reach and the player must use stealth and cover (usually thick bushes, logs, and rock formations)to avoid does, noisy terrain, and other animals like birds. The player is also given a device called a UTD that measures your presence to the animals. A low-pitched beep means that the animals can't detect you, while high-pitched beeps tells the player that animals have spotted the player and they will run away. A timed hunt is activated either when you reach your target, a predator or another force could disturb the animals and the player must kill it in a certain amount of time; or when the animals appear as a large herd and the player must kill a certain amount of males before time runs out. Many birds and small mammals roam around for the player to shoot at their leisure. Sometimes the player can reach a hidden area, where they have an opportunity to photograph rare animals and natural behaviors. There's also a gun store where players can buy, customize, and upgrade their weapons.

The game also features multiplayer where players can create either an area found in campaign mode, or customize their own. Players can create custom animals, which they can hunt with friends. Players can set challenges to compete in hunting the rarest animals and like Campaign mode, players can also buy and customize their weapons for each type of situation (a typical weapon is usually a variation of a scoped hunting rifle). There are multiple shooting galleries like arcade, where you can kill as many animals as want, or reflex which tests your hunting skills by instructing the player to kill certain animals in a chronological order. The game is planned to be released packaged with the Top Shot Elite, a plastic peripheral for the Wii controller.

Source: Wikipedia, "Cabela's Big Game Hunter 2012", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

161808.name: Destiny of Spirits
161808.description:
Destiny of Spirits is a free-to-play online social strategy game with RPG elements exclusively for the PlayStation Vita. The game is divided into three online regions, namely Asia, the Americas, and Europe, each with a separate server.

The game features special collaboration spirits, including Kat from Gravity Rush, and Sony mascot Toro.

Source: Wikipedia, "Destiny of Spirits," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

161809.name: Pavilion
videogamehonor: 2015 AzPlay Awards Best Game Design Winner
2015 AzPlay Awards Best Music/Sound Nominee
2015 AzPlay Awards Most Re-Playable Game Nominee
161809.description:
User Summary

The character is not your avatar and you are not in control of him, instead you have to find different ways, mostly through environmental interaction, to try to guide, influence or even force him to explore and fulfill the purpose of the world.

161810.name: Let It Die
161810.description:
User Summary

Let It Die is a free-to-play PlayStation 4 exclusive. The game will use other players’ data and that you’ll be able take their weapons and clothes to customize your character.

161811.name: Final Fantasy Type-0
videogamehonor: 2015 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Multiplatform Game of the Year Nominee
161811.description:
Final Fantasy Type-0 was first released on PlayStation Portable in Japan. A western release for PlayStation 4 and Xbox One titled Final Fantasy Type-0 HD was confirmed. Type-0 is part of the Fabula Nova Crystallis subseries, a set of games sharing a common mythos which includes Final Fantasy XIII and Final Fantasy XV. The gameplay is reminiscent of Crisis Core: Final Fantasy VII, with the player taking direct control of characters and taking them on missions and large-scale battles.

The game was originally announced as a title for mobile phones called Final Fantasy Agito XIII. It is directed by Hajime Tabata, who also directed Before Crisis: Final Fantasy VII. It was designed to provide players with easy access to the Fabula Nova Crystallis mythos. The game was eventually moved onto the PSP and its title was changed to distance it from Final Fantasy XIII, the subseries' flagship title.

Source: Wikipedia, "Final Fantasy Type-0," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

161812.name: Final Fantasy X|X-2 HD Remaster
videogameversion: Japanese PlayStation 3 'Final Fantasy X HD' edition
Japanese PlayStation 3 'Final Fantasy X-2 HD' edition
Japanese PlayStation Vita 'Final Fantasy X HD' edition
Japanese PlayStation Vita 'Final Fantasy X-2 HD' edition
161812.description:
Final Fantasy X/X-2 HD Remaster is a high-definition remaster of the role-playing video games Final Fantasy X and Final Fantasy X-2. It features story content previously only found in the International versions, and a new audio drama set a year after the events of X-2. The collection saw graphical and musical revisions and is based on the international versions of both games, making certain special features missing in the original releases accessible to non-Japanese players for the first time.

Source: Wikipedia, "Final Fantasy X/X-2 HD Remaster," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

161813.description:
In January of 1848, an event occurred which changed the face of the west—gold was discovered on the American River in California. News spread around the world and the era of the 49’ers began. Thousands of young people left their farms and homes to make their fortunes out west.

As these pioneers swarmed to California, hundreds of mining camps sprang up throughout the Mother Lode. Eight miles from the gold discovery site, a camp known as “Old Dry Diggins” was established. By 1849, it became known as “Hangtown.” There are many stories as to how this infamous nickname came to be, but the most common is that in January of 1849, after a very brief trial, three men were hung from a large oak tree near the corner of Main and Center Streets—an act of swift justice, as they say.

In April and again in July of 1856, most of Old Hangtown, now bearing the name Placerville, was destroyed by fire. Buildings were ultimately built of brick and stone thereafter. In addition, a large bell tower was erected in the center of town as a fire warning system. By then, people had begun to value the area for more than just mining. The region had an abundance of lumber and rich agricultural land, making it perfectly situated to grow into a thriving community.

____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

In the game of Hangtown, players become Gold Rush era Pioneers who are competing for riches, resources, property, and prestige. …They must also be prepared to deal with outlaws, shootouts, and hangings at the infamous Hangman’s Tree!

The game features a thoughtful variety of streamlined mechanics, which are notably innovative, yet traditional and familiar in feel—such as fresh spins on tableau building, worker placement, simultaneous action selection, variable turn order, and resource and hand management.

Some of the best strategies in Hangtown rely on a balance between optimizing one’s own scheme and cunningly “playing the players”. A standout theme in the game is “Boom or Bust”. If a player can get “out of phase” for a turn, he or she will profit from a “Boom yield” and get bonuses, while the other players may go “Bust” and get very little. But of course, this takes sharp wits and some clever guesswork…

The game is played in a series of rounds, which break down into a series of turns and phases. In a turn, each player selects one card that will determine the phase that his or her Pioneer will take action in. When the players are ready, they simultaneously reveal their chosen cards and place their Pioneer pawns in the corresponding yield sites on the board.

Then the phases are resolved in numeric order as the players take their Pioneers’ actions. The total number of Pioneers in each yield site determines whether the outcome is Boom or Bust. To whatever degree, the different site actions allow the players to place workers, activate workers, collect resources, and add cards to their face-up tableau areas of historic buildings, districts, and monuments. Every card built in a tableau grants the player new abilities as well as Victory Points for the final scoring.

After each turn is completed, the looming Outlaw pawn advances into the next section of the board, locking that particular yield site into a Bust outcome. Furthermore, when the Outlaw lands in the last section, it triggers a “Final Shootout”! In this special phase, all of the players must defend themselves against the Outlaw’s bold attack by using gunmen positioned on Main Street. If the players beat the Outlaw, they gain additional Victory Points as a reward. But if they fail, they must send their lost gunmen to their early graves in the Union Cemetery…

The Wild West theme of the game is based closely on the California Gold Rush of 1849 through the turn of the century. The city of Placerville, also known as Old Hangtown, has a rich history, which has been worked into the game at every juncture. For instance, the town cards feature historic landmarks such as the Bell Tower, Soda Works, and Studebaker Wheelbarrow Shop; while the periodic “Events” feature the Wagon Train, mail delivery from Snowshoe Thompson, and digging up The Mother Lode at Gold Bug Mine. Many beautifully restored historic photographs and illustrations are included as well.

Hangtown plays wonderfully with two to six players, and it can be set to play in two separate modes: Discovery for newcomers and casual gamers, and Highgrade for seasoned gamers and experienced players. The modes appeal to a wide range of folks and settings—from light family fun to heavy brain burning. The game also includes an expansion that opens up bidding on several character roles. These roles, such as the Robber, Deputy, Prospector, and Gunslinger, allow each player to use a unique special ability for one entire round at a time.

The game offers many paths to victory and great replayability.
161813.name: Hangtown

161814.name: Eine Reise durch Deutschland
161814.description:
This is a promotional board game for "Hederich-Kainit" and "Kali-Dünger".

The players travel from Berlin (space 1) to Bückeberg (space 90). Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces the players have to follow special instructions from the game rules.
The first player to arrive in Bückeberg, wins the game.

161815.name: After Burst
161815.description:
After Burst (アフターバースト?) is a Japan-exclusive action video game released for the Game Boy in 1990.

Players must control a combat robot as they make their way towards their ultimate goal: destroying the enemy orb. Each level only has one screen to blast hostile robots, solve challenging platforms, and manipulate a series of short puzzles.

Source: Wikipedia, "After Burst", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

161816.name: Der Fluch des Drachengrafen
rpgseries: Das Schwarze Auge (DSA) 5th edition beta adventures
161816.description:
(user summary)

A beta test adventure for DSA 5th edition.

The heroes are searching for the victim of a kidnapping, thereby stumbling upon the secrets of the "Drachengrafen".

161817.name: Greedocracy
161817.description:
You are the CEO of a multinational mega corporation with strong ties to the influential circles of politics. Manipulate the market and bribe government officials, invest in weapons and market tobacco to kids, set up sweat shops and use child workers, dump chemical waste in a nature reserve and support evil dictators to gain access to valuable natural resources – everything is ok as long as it gains you more Power, Prestige and Personal wealth than anyone else. Remember: there is no such thing as enough!

GAME PLAY OVERVIEW
Each turn, all players simultaneously draft a card from their hand of cards as well as puts out one card to the upcoming market. Players then get to pick a card from the current face up market in an order depending on the dollar value of the cards the players drafted. Each player then hands their remaining cards to their left and a new turn starts.

By the end of the game, players want to have the majority in certain suits (Red/White Exploit suit and Purple Shady suit) as well as forming triples and straights in the Blue Financial suit. Extra profit points are scored for each tie that was successfully connected by combining two matching cards.

The player with the most Profit points is the winner.

161818.name: Splittermond: Die Regeln
161818.description:
User summary:
Core rulebook for the German fantasy RPG Splittermond, containing everything that is needed for playing: character creation, rules for skills, combat and magic, equipment, monsters, a gamemaster section and a short presentation of the world of Lorakis.

161819.name: Top-It! Grand Prix Game
161819.description:
This is a card game using a mixture of 9 types of cards (Start Racing, Slow Trafic, Engine Blows Up, Pit Stop, New Tyres, Tyre burst and 5, 10 and 15 laps). The winner is the first person complete 100 laps by getting five 5 laps cards and three each of 10 and 15 laps cards onto the table in front of them ("the Tableaux")by legal means.
Each player is dealt a hand of 5 cards and a turn consists of drawing one card and either adding a card to his own or opponent's tableaux or discarding.
Lap cards can only be added if certain precursor cards have been laid previously and some of these can be canceled by other cards played onto them by opponents.

161820.description:
French Wars of Religion - Volume 1
Dreux 1562
La Roche l’Abeille 1569
Coutras 1587

- Dreux 1562
As the first pitched battle of the French Wars of Religion, Dreux began with an enthusiastic charge by Coligny’s cavalry. All the Royalist infantry, except the Swiss, was put in disorder. The attacks and counter-attacks would continue until Guise and Saint-André’s troops, passive until that point, overwhelmed the Huguenots. At the end of the day, almost all the commanders of the two camps were killed or taken prisoner. Despite the Protestant rout, the war would continue for a long time !

-La Roche l’Abeille 1569
After the assassination of the Prince of Condé at Jarnac during the third French War of Religion, Coligny regrouped the Protestant forces near the Vienne. He managed to surprise the Duke of Anjou, who had set off in pursuit of him, despite his strong defensive position. At dawn, Coligny’s avant-garde progressed through hedges and thickets. The Royalist infantry, knocked about by the Protestant cavaliers, was beaten and their commander, Filippo Strozzi, taken prisoner. This victory would be a limited and fleeting one.

- Coutras 1587
The eighth and final French War of Religion began with Henri of Navarre's first battle as commander in chief. Faced with the Royalist troops commanded by the Duke of Joyeuse, “Premier mignon du Roy”, Navarre took advantage of the night to position his troops near Coutras. At ten o’clock, the charge of the Royalist gendarmes hit the first line of Huguenot cavalry despite the deadly fire of the artillery commanded by Sully. But the counter-charge of Navarre, Condé and Soissons shifted the course of the battle and destroyed the morale of Joyeuse’s troops. The ensuing massacre caused the deaths of Joyeuse, his brother, and numerous other noblemen.
161820.name: Avec Infini Regret

161821.name: Gloranthan olennot ja salaisuudet
161821.description:
User summary:
This is a combined translation of parts of two Runequest source books: The Book 1 from Elder Secrets of Glorantha and a version of Gloranthan Bestiary compressed in 32 pages. The Book 2 from Elder Secrets is translated as another book named Gloranthan Vanhat Rodut.

Translation from back of the book:
Since the creation of Glorantha many creatures have walked it's surface and many secrets still hide inside it. For over 16 centuries brave researchers have searched these. You hold the product of their work.

The creatures and secrets of Glorantha (Gloranthan olennot ja salaisuudet) includes:

CREATURES: 73 creatures species from Ahmatti to Öiviir, including their game stats and descriptions.

SECRETS: Monsters and horrors, such as Lunar Crimsom Bat, unique secrets like Paasi (The Stone) and Egg of Eranglos Karastombar, Inaccessible Glorantha like Dorastor, Secrets of Dragonkind, Magical Geology of Glorantha, Sky and Weather of Glorantha and information about Heroquesting.

161822.name: Stoneheart Valley (Swords and Wizardry)
161822.description:
From the Publisher Website:

Finally, welcome to the World of Necromancer Games! From Bill Webb and Clark Peterson's home campaign comes the old-school setting of The Lost Lands: Stoneheart Valley. For over a decade, fans of Necromancer Games and Frog God Games have been asking to see the world behind the adventures. And at long last, here is where it all began, in the Stoneheart Valley near the town of Fairhill. This mini-campaign was originally presented to the fans of Necromancer Games in three separate modules: "The Wizard's Amulet", "The Crucible of Freya", and "The Tomb of Abysthor". Frog God Games has taken the full series from the 3E version plus supplemental material previously available only online, and converted it all to the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game system and the Swords & Wizardry Complete ruleset.

161823.name: Du glaubst zu schieben und du wirst geschoben!
161823.description: The players must get their meeple from space "Start" on the outher ring to space 100 in the center of the game board. The movement is determined by a die. On a space with an arrow the meeples advance to the next ring inward or have to return one ring outward. If a meeple gets on an occupied space, the other meeple must return to the lowest numbered space on the ring they're on. The first player to get his meeple on space 100 winns the game.

161824.name: Battle Realms 2: Lair of the Lotus
161824.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




User Summary

Battle Realms 2: Lair of the Lotus will take place within the same universe of the first game. It features a return to the mainland.

161825.name: Farming Simulator 14
161825.description:
User Summary

original quote from the developer's website: Farming Simulator 14 invites you into the challenging world of a modern day farmer. Take on all the challenges of farming life, including animal husbandry (cows), crops, sales ... it’s up to you to manage and grow your own farm in an open world. As your career progresses, you will have access to a huge selection of farming vehicles and machines, faithfully recreated from the biggest names in the industry.

After Farming Simulator 2013 a new game was released. Farming Simulator 14 is basically a limited and easier version of FS'13. There are less brands of machinery available, there's a small map, which is always the same. FS'14 was released for mobiles and handhelds, focusing on a more casual gaming experience. Though for mobiles the app is quite cheap (and sometimes available for free), a lot of the better machines are only available as purchasable DownLoadable Content (DLC) through the ingame shop.

Network multiplayer for mobile is supported both through Bluetooth or WiFi

161827.name: Four Suits of War
161827.description:
Four Suits of War (subtitle: A Swords & Sorcery Card Game) is a game involving a standard deck of playing cards and some six-sided dice. (The game only includes the rules pamphlet; cards and dice are not included.)

In this game, clubs and spades become armies, diamonds become spells, hearts become armor, and face cards are heroes and leaders. Luck of the draw and luck of the dice play a great part in the outcome of the game, but skill and strategy are an important aspect as well. A quick game for two or more players.

161829.name: Shadowgate (2014)
161829.description:
“The last thing that you remember is standing before the wizard Lakmir as he gestured wildly and chanted in an archaic tongue. Now you find yourself staring at an entryway which lies at the edge of a forest.”

So begins the legend of Shadowgate – one of the most well-known and well-loved point-and-click adventure titles in gaming history. As one of the original titles in the popular MacVenture series which went on to be celebrated on the NES, GBC and Nintendo 64, Shadowgate quickly endeared players with its fantastic atmospheric soundtrack, perilous locations to progress through, countless puzzles to solve, and more ways to gruesomely die than gamers previously thought possible. Thrust into the role of “The Seed of Prophecy,” players travel deep into the living castle, in hopes of defeating the evil that dwells within – the dread Warlock Lord.

Now, nearly 30 years after the original version haunted Mac and NES gamers, the original development team behind that timeless classic is back with a full re-imagining of the original Shadowgate. Much more than a port, the team at Zojoi has painstakingly redesigned the game from the ground up, adding in tons of new mind-bending puzzles, lots of new rooms with stunning hand-painted 2D graphical detail, and more objects to interact with and help you along your quest.

Decide how YOU want to play this new, re-imagined Shadowgate! Want the quintessential experience? Employ the omnipresent Classic command system or turn on the retro soundtrack, text box and room transitions. Want a more cinematic experience? Switch to Immersive mode by auto-hiding the UI and using customizable hotkeys to explore the castle. Or mix and match the options to satisfy your play style. In Shadowgate, there are plenty of new features and fun throwbacks to the original version, to satisfy veteran adventurers and newcomers alike!

KEY FEATURES:

First Person Adventuring: Utilize your inventory, mapping system and intuitive on-screen commands to complete your quest.
Rooms: Tons of Beautifully illustrated rooms featuring both new and familiar locations, offering a new play experience.
Puzzles: Lots of new and updated puzzles that seamlessly expand on the original game.
Difficulty Levels: Three different difficulty levels that actually change the game play experience and puzzle structure.
Customized UI: Play the way you want! Use classic on-screen commands or jump into Immersive mode and auto-hide the UI elements. Create key binds, lock commands and keys and more.
Retro Mode: Play the game like it’s 1989! Listen to Hiroyuki Masuno’s original NES chip tunes, move between rooms with pixelated transitions and follow the text in retro format.
Storytelling: Features dramatic cut-scenes and all the same great storytelling you expect from the original creators.
Cinematic Score: A digitally-orchestrated, dynamic soundtrack that changes with game play by composer Rich Douglas.
Soundscapes: A complete atmospheric and puzzle-based sound design featuring hundreds of sound effects.
Achievements: 50 in-game and Steam-based achievements to find and unlock.
Animations: Environmental and object-specific animations and particles bring each location to life.
Help: Need a hint? An in-game help system is just a click away.

Source: The Developer Website.

161830.name: Sariniya's Curse
161830.description:
From the publisher's description:

Iaxos, south of Meeros, is a mysterious island with a terrible reputation. When Trimostones the Gold needs to go there for reasons unknown, it's the characters he turns to for help. What challenges lie ahead? What dangers and what ancient secrets?

Sariniya's Curse is an introductory adventure for RuneQuest 6. All you need is either the core or Essentials rules. The scenario comes complete with four pre-generated characters - or you can create your own.

161831.name: The Arkham Gazette (Issue 1 - Nov 2013)
rpgissuearticle: Report of Delusions of an Invisible Monster
Thaumaturgical Prodigies in the New-English Canaan
The Case of the Missing Manhole Covers
161831.description:
"Welcome to the first regular issue of the Arkham Gazette, a periodical dedicated to Lovecraft Country. In this issue we turn our attention to “witch-haunted” Arkham itself, home of Miskatonic University and the de facto center of the Lovecraft Country universe.
For your reading pleasure we present an octet of articles uncovering various heretofore unknown corners of Arkham – a guide to lesser known Arkham spots presented in scenarios – the Gladding School, an institution dedicated to the ‘improvement’ of Arkham’s mentally impaired children – a deep delve into the Thaumaturgical Prodigies in the New-English Canaan – a brief overview of Arkham’s boundary markers – a scenario seed involving the occult and the Arkham Water Department – a curious journal article presenting a trio of cases of delusion and inexplicable blood loss – “The Bosworth House”, a scenario suggesting that when a house is not a home, it can become something truly terrible – and finally notes on the 60(!) scenarios set in Arkham."
- From publisher website

161832.name: Heroes in Space! The Right Stuffing
161832.description:
from the book cover

This is the voyage of the starship Centipede. Its mission: to help the Fuzzy Heroes new Alien friends regain their Lucky Star. To defeat the Renegades that have taken the Lucky Star by force, driving them back to their holdings in FrolicHaven. To make space exploration safe for all toy kind.

161833.name: The Arkham Gazette (Issue 2 - May 2014)
rpgissuearticle: Edward S. Morse, Zoologist and Orientalist
The Hymnal of the Esoteric Order of Dagon
“[T]he marine abyss just beyond Devil Reef”
161833.description:
"Welcome to the second regular issue of the Arkham Gazette. We hope the delays that put this issue behind schedule are at least balanced, if not exceeded by the improvements they allowed us to make.
In this issue we visit the noisome port of Innsmouth. Hop on to Joe Sargent's bus and ride along..."
- From Introduction

161834.description:
The Shoguns enemies have escaped! As a Ninja, you are tasked to capture them back. But beware! Your rival Ninjas are on the same task! It's an all-out war to gain the Shoguns favor! Who will win?

The objective of the game is to acquire victory points by going from locations to locations and defeating as many hidden enemies as you can and reach the end of the game by defeating all bosses hidden inside the Enemies pile while preventing your life from reducing to 0. At the end of the game, the player or team of players with the most number of victory points wins!

General Game flow per players turn are as follows:
1. Reveal a Location from Locations Pile and put it into the center field face-up
2. You may activate an item card that has no effects of boosting attack result
2. Do the action stated in the revealed Location Card
3. If the card stated for a battle then do the following:
a. Reveal Enemy cards stated in the revealed location card and put it into the center field face-up
b. You may activate an item card effect to boost attack result
c. Roll 2D6 Die and get the result
d. If total attack result is more than combined enemy life points then move revealed enemy cards from the center field to your side of the field as capture. If not then you may choose to defeat enemy cards following their card conditions and move them to your side of the field. then apply the penalties from the remaining enemy cards and the revealed location card.
4. You may return any captured Enemy Cards from your side of the field to the bottom of their decks to gain their equivalent coin value.
5. Return all revealed cards in the center field to the bottom of their decks.
6. The turn passes to the next player.

The game flow goes on until the one of following conditions is met:
1. All bosses within the Enemy deck are captured
2. One of the players loses all their life points
3. A card effect stated to end the game immediately

In a Single player, if the player manages to capture all bosses without losing all their life points than the play wins, other wise the player loses then game.

In a multi-player battle, At the end of the game, players must add all the equivalent Victory Points in the enemy cards and their remaining lifepoints at 5 victory points each and all coins at 1 victory point each. The player or the group of player with the most number of Victory points wins the game!
161834.name: Way of the Ninja: Capture the Shoguns Enemies!

161835.description:
Welcome to Planetary Reign, the strategic game of empire building, space exploration, planet colonization and resource management. Planetary Reign is a space civilization game based on classic video games of the same genre from the 1980's and 90's in which each player is the leader of a space-faring empire that is attempting to expand into and exploit the riches of a new-found galaxy. Planetary Reign provides a rich 4X experience without an overly complex rule-set and can be played within a couple of hours.

As a leader of THULE, VEYNA, METHIOS or CALDERA, you will assign your workers to a variety of actions - choosing which, when and how often they will be performed - with the ultimate goal being to dominate the galaxy and ensure the survival of your people. Your empire will build, upgrade and send its fleets into a galaxy to explore its unknown worlds. There, you will encounter planets with strange environments, hosts of alien species and a variety of resources as well as occasionally running into your opponents.

The main mechanics employed in Planetary Reign are worker placement, area control and a new specie assimilation mechanic. With nearly 5 years in development, Planetary Reign has been designed for players who enjoy medium to heavy games with low luck factors. There are multiple scoring paths and rounds - the winner being the empire with the most points at the end of the game.
161835.name: Planetary Reign

161837.name: Gloranthan Vanhat Rodut
161837.description:
User summary:
This is a finnish translation of Book 2 of Elder Secrets of Glorantha, only concentrating on the Elder Races. The Book 1 is published separately as part of Gloranthan olennot ja salaisuudet.

Translation from back of the book:
Gloranthan Vanhat Rodut (eng. Elder Races of Glorantha)
Year is 1623 AA
This book tells about elder races of Glorantha - elfs, dwarfs, trolls, broos, ogres, night riders, giants, ducks, children of wind and lizardfolk. Also included are grotaron, luatha, ludoki, morokanth, jelmre, slark, timini and waertag. All the aforementionedraces have descriptions of e.g. culture, relations with other races, warfare, religion and enough information for character creation.

The book also includes two new cults in Glorantha - Bloody Fang and Cacodemon cults. In addition, this book includes adventures for diferent races and a map showing concentrations of major elder races is also included.

What is Glorantha
Glorantha is a fantasy world, which has exotic myths, magnificent magic and unique creation. The existence and use of magical powers is essential for life in Glorantha. Here living gods protect their worshippers and advance their own causes.

161838.name: Champions of Fire Mountain
161838.description:
In Champions of Fire Mountain, you represent one of four clans battling for supremacy in the Frankish Kingdom of 768 AD. Drawing upon the four elements across the land, you use their power to build a variety of medieval buildings to empower your army for battle. Once all opponents have been beaten in combat, the final victor is crowned Champion of Fire Mountain.

In Champions, each player begins with 5 Basic Lands and 5 Light Soldiers. In the center of the table, a random selection of Building cards, Treasures and Soldiers can be purchased and added to each player's decks during their turn. Through skilled planning, players amass more cards and use their armies to defeat all the opponents on the table.

Champions contains 342 cards, consisting of 20 Building Sets, 3 Soldier varieties, 3 Treasure options, 4 Basic Land piles and 12 Legendary Cards. Players chose 8 out of 20 Building Sets to create game variety and use their Soldiers to reduce their opponent's life score from 30 to 0.

161839.name: Röllin Sydän
161839.description: Four different characters will race for the Heart of Knowledge. Each player controls two identical characters figures. On his/her turn the player rolls a die and moves either of his characters forward, backward or sideways exactly the number of spaces indicated on the die. If you ever land on a space opposing figurine is occupying, the opposing figure is knocked down and moved to the starting place or a resting place. There are safe places on your journey but also obstacles that will slow you down. The first player to get his two characters figures to the goal wins the game!

161840.name: Shoot Pixels
161840.description:
User Summary

Shoot Pixels is a game in which you control a single tank via WASD keys to move and mouse to aim the turret and fire. There are 40 rounds that escalate in difficulty and you battle to destroy the enemy tanks.

Completing a round gives a money bonus which you use to upgrade your tank. There is also a weapons designer which lets you build a customised guns.

161842.description:
A veil of shadows has taken over the lands of Kemet. As the souls of the fighters float above the black lands of ancient Egypt, a gloomy wind provides a new inspiration for the gods of Kemet. Will you be able to master it?

Ta-Seti, the first expansion for Kemet, adds several new things to the base game:


A new pyramid color with corresponding power tiles
A new game phase (dawn)
The path of the souls
New DI cards


Players can choose which parts of the expansion to add, as each module works on its own in addition to meshing with the other modules.

161846.description: A punch board with twenty-nine new tiles for the US army. Requires the Heroes of Normandie base game to play.

161847.description:
From the box description:

London, 1890:
In the fog veiled streets of the city monsters are on the loose – what a nuisance for the good and hard working citizens! Queen Victoria is not amused and prescribes a bounty for every captured beast.
Become a monster hunter, catch the monsters and earn loads of money!
______________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Monsters of London is a dice-driven card game for 2-5 monster hunters.
Capture monsters and collect coins by rolling dice and pressing your luck to get the right combinations, or just steal from your opponents.
Use your monster's abilities in cunning combinations and win this fast paced game as the richest monster hunter of all times.
______________________________________________________________________________________________________________

The game was designed and developed as Design Bachelor Thesis project in 2014 by Patricia Limberger and Felix Leder.
The first edition's 36 exclusive copies were hand manufactured.

161848.description: This expansion includes two survivors and their Zombivor counterparts both designed by Miguel Coimbra.
161848.name: Zombicide Special Guest Box: Miguel Coimbra

161849.description:
Land 6 is a board game for one player (a solo game) with an approximate duration of 15 minutes.

You are The Lord of the Dice, in eternal battle against The Lord of the Cubes, fighting for the world known as Land 6. To defeat him you must conquer his city with one of your armies, and you must do it... with just six dice!

Components: six dice (your army), six cubes (Lord of the Cubes army), an action die and six tiles (with a number 1-6 and four squares: city, sea, forest and growing field) for the board game.

The object of the game is to conquer Land 6. For this you must place one of your armies (one die) in the city of The Lord of the Cubes (city square on tile number 6). You have different actions that you can activate with your armies (substrating a point for a die in a square), while avoiding that the armies of The Lord of the Cubes conquer the world.

If your cities are defeated or The Lord of the Cubes deploys all their armies, you lose. If you conquer his city, you win.

2014 Solitaire Print and Play Contest results:

Best Small Sized Game
2nd place - Land 6 by Santiago Eximeno
161849.name: Land 6

161851.name: Pony My Love
161851.description:
This is the day of the great horse show! Our riders prepare theirs horses and stay focused despite unexpected competition and traps set by their opponents. A game of combinations and love which unites the rider and his horse will overcome all the trials!

In order to win you have to prepare your pony for the competition before others competitors. To do this, each player must collect the following cards in order: Halter, Pony, Grooming, Fillet, Saddle Pad, Saddle

The First Player to complete these six steps wins.


C'est le jour du grand concours équestre ! Nos cavalières doivent préparer leurs montures et rester concentrées malgré les imprévus de la compétition et les pièges tendus par leurs adversaires. Un jeu de combinaisons ou l'amour, qui uni la cavalière et sa monture, saura triompher de toutes les épreuves !

Pour gagner, il faut préparer son poney pour le concours avant les autres concurrents. Pour ce faire, chaque joueur doit collecter, dans l'ordre, les cartes suivantes : Licol, Poney, Pansage, Filet, Tapis, Selle.

Le premier joueur qui parvient à accomplir ces 6 étapes remporte la manche.

161854.name: Misti'zzle Of La Fontaine
161854.description:
Où se cache le Corbeau ?
Avec le Renard...
La Cigale va-t-elle retrouver sa fourmi ?

Animé par les personnages des célèbres Fables de La Fontaine, Misti’zzle est un jeu de cartes basé sur l’observation au graphisme adapté pour les enfants.

Le but du jeu est d’assembler un maximum de cartes par paire pour former des mini-scènes des Fables de La Fontaine, en évitant d’avoir en main à la fin de la partie, la carte Mistigri représentée par le Chat Botté du conte de Perrault.

Les mini-scènes s’assemblent ensemble à la manière d’un puzzle pour créer le Misti’zzle (un puzzle de 4 cartes de haut sur 10 cartes de large).

--

Each player organises and places all their existing pairs face up on the table. Then the youngest player begins by taking at random any card from the player to his left in the hope of matching a new pair. If he makes a pair with this new card, he places it face up on the table, and takes another card from the same player to his left. If not he keeps the card and the next player takes his turn and play continues thus, until there are no more pairs. Gradually as
the game progresses the players are able to assemble the Misti’zzle a tableau presenting images of the stories of Jean de La Fontaine.

161855.name: City Siege 3: Jungle Siege
161855.description:
User Summary

A platform game where you control a number of soldiers and run along the level shooting enemies and rescuing civilians by walking into them. You can collect stars to upgrade your units. Each successful mission results in a cash reward which can be spent on units for the next mission.

161856.name: City Siege 4: Alien Siege
161856.description:
User Summary

Side-scrolling platform game in which you control a team of futuristic military units on missions to kill enemy troops and rescue civilians. You control the units via keyboard WASD with mouse to aim and shoot. After each successful mission you receive reward money and you can use this to purchase more and/or better troops.

161857.name: City Siege Sniper
161857.description:
User Summary

City Siege Sniper is a game in which you play as a sniper, killing enemies and allowing civilians to escape danger. Each level has a number of civilians being threatened by enemies. You pan around the level via WASD keys, use mouse to aim and fire, and spacebar to duck under cover. You can throw stones to distract enemies as well as simply shooting them. In some cases a civilian has multiple guards so distraction is necessary for them to escape.

161858.name: Philippines Ablaze: A Solitaire Game of the Philippine Insurrection (1899-1902)
161858.description:
BACKGROUND: Philippines Ablaze is semi-historical simulation of the United States war in the Philippines to put down the insurrection of General Aguinaldo. The Game begins shortly after the Insurrectionist Leader, General Emilio Aguinaldo, declares independence from the United States controlled government of the Philippines.

OBJECTIVE: Player takes command of the United States Forces in the Philippines. The Player’s Objective is to attempt to capture four of the five Key Insurrecto Controlled Settlements (San Fernando, Tuao, San Jose, Puerto Galera, Cagayan) before the last Campaign Card is played, the Insurrectionists Win.

GAME FEATURES: The game features a fun and simplistic method for resolving solitaire combat tactically, rules for Heroes that can make an impact on the outcome of battles, and lots of colorful game counters.

161859.description: A promotional mini-expansion, including two new heroes, one for the US forces and another for the German forces.
161859.name: Heroes of Normandie: Bill Furlong & Siegfried

161861.name: Aspects of Fantasy
161861.description:
From the back of the book:

Welcome to Aspects of Fantasy, a fantasy roleplaying game that takes the familiar D20 rules system and updates it with rules and concepts from the popular Fate rules engine.

In Aspects of Fantasy you will find:


 A streamlined version of the D20 system


* Rules for using aspects and fate points with characters, equipment, adventuring parties, and creatures


 Quick character creation rules with 8 races (clurichauns, dwarves, elves, gnomes, halflings, humans, orgars, witchbloods) and 8 classes (adventurer, barbarian, cleric, fighter, knight, mage, ranger, rogue) along with a number of backgrounds and traits



 Rules for using fate points as a commodity to power traits and maneuvers



 Critical and fumble rules along with an easy to use skill system



 A D20 magic system that better integrates with aspects and fate points along with over 150+ spells



 Conversion information for using Aspects of Fantasy with your Pathfinder and D20 products, along with a dozen sample creatures to get you started


Aspects of Fantasy can be used to integrate elements of Fate into any version of your favorite fantasy roleplaying game, or it can be used as a way introduce your D20/Pathfinder players to concepts in the Fate rules system.

161862.name: Tiger Attack!  The Battle of the Bulge, Ardennes 1944
161862.description:
A relatively fast, very playable point-to-point game at roughly regiment/combat command/brigade unit scale and 1-day per turn time scale, using my simple Dark Crusade combat table and system, plus Disruption and fortification. U.S. starts with 19 units, Germans with many more. Playing time is a couple hours.

Special Peiper, Bayerlein, and Abrams leader counters and a Skorzeny 150th Brigade Brandenburgers unit are included, as well as the 2 historical Tiger tank battalions. (Some offensive-shocked GIs were reporting any panzer as being a Tiger tank.)

Fuel is unlimited for the Americans and crucial and weather-dependent for the Germans - vs. Allied airpower. My Patton's Prayer rule (for better weather) from my hex-and-counter Tigers in the Ardennes is included, as is a rule for the chance of a "blonde and beautiful" U.S. Army nurse diverting Bayerlein's attention, as occurred historically and possibly decisively on his/Panzer Lehr Division's way to Bastogne.

Map and units can alternatively be used with Major Battles and Campaigns combat system.

161866.description:
Zombicide Season 3: Rue Morgue is a cooperative game set in an action-movie universe for 1 to 12 players, ages 13 and up. Players control teams of survivors as they fight off a zombie horde controlled by the game itself. Survivors find weapons, battle zombies, and gain experience. The more experienced they get, the more powerful they become, but the more zombies they attract!

Zombicide Season 3: Rue Morgue introduces a terrifying new zombie type: the Skinner Zombie! Make sure you put these zombies down hard, otherwise something might come crawling for you! And don't forget Season 3's new big bad is the A-Bomb Abomination! An Abomination so twisted and mutated that its elongated arms can drag you back to it as you try to escape!

With all these new foes you're going to need to team up if you want to survive!! Zombicide Season 3: Rue Morgue introduces teams into the Zombicide franchise! Players pick from the largest pool of survivors in a Zombicide game yet and form teams to scavenge, loot, and kill zombies! And if you really want to shred through the shuffling dead, you’ll first need to make sure your team has skills that complement each other well.

Zombicide Season 3: Rue Morgue has new zombies, new weapons, new survivors, and even new team mechanics, but the biggest game changer of all is the new optional Player versus Player rule set! Yes, in Rue Morgue players' teams can go toe-to-toe to see which set of Survivors really deserve to survive! If the zombie apocalypse isn't horrifying enough for you, then prepare to face off against the deadliest foe yet: Man!

161867.name: Was kommt dazu
161867.description:
Was kommt dazu (What's added now) is a tile laying game.

It consists of 72 square cardboard tiles, similar to the tiles of a memory game, and a rulebook. There are 6 tile series with different pictures. 3 series of 16 tiles each (steamboat, wonder machine, sun flower), 2 series of 9 tiles each (flowers of the spring, bird), 1 series of 6 tiles (helicopter). The basic idea is that one tile of each series has the least amount of small details, another one the greatest amount of details (like with or without doorknow depicted, a bee with or without wings etc.). These cards must be sorted according to the amount of details picted from least to most in ascending order. A check is possible by turing the tiles around. On each tile back is one half of an animal or thing - horse, train car etc. If the cards are in correct order those halves match.

The rulebook suggests 3 games:
1) Solo game: The solo player takes one or more tile series, shuffles them and must lay them in the correct order.
2) Group game: The short helicopter series is done away with. Each player gets one tile series (well shuffled). Players start to put their series in order. The first player to do this wins - if he did correctly. This can be done with one round or in several rounds. If rounds are played the player who finishes first and has his order correct he gets victory points equal to the number of tiles in the series plus 5 extra points. The other players get one victory point for each tile that is in correct order. For the next round the series are shuffled again and each player gets another series than before.
3) What is disappeared: A series is laid on the table in random order. The picture with the most details is laid in the middle. Players look out for the tile where just one little detail disappeared then the next one etc.

161868.name: The Basilean Legacy
161868.description:
The Basilean Legacy is a supplement for Mantic's Kings of War (KoW). KoW is a miniatures wargame set in a fantasy world and Basilean Legacy expands both setting's background and wargame by providing three new army lists. The new army lists are the Basilean Army (good aligned humans backed by angelic beings); Forces of Nature (neutral aligned fey and elementals) and Forces of the Abyss (evil aligned monsters and demons).

In addition to the background information and new army lists, the supplement also expands magic artefacts and one of the original spells (Zap!) in the original KoW rules. These changes to magic provide additional variety in gameplay and approaches to magic strategy in the game.

The supplement is available as a hard copy version and in electronic PDF format.

161869.name: Castle Blast
161869.description: Castle Blast is the action game of clever destruction for kids of all ages. Armed with a wrecking ball, your target is the enemy castle. Your goal? Save the princess, retrieve the king’s treasure and defeat the dragon. Earn a token for each successful feat. But aim carefully: clear the wrong piece from the board and you lose a token. The first player to claim all three tokens wins the game! This heirloom-quality game includes 26 solid wood castle blocks, 1 wooden game board, 1 wrecking ball, 3 character blocks, 1 die, 12 tokens and instructions.

161870.name: Flying Kung-Fu Frogs
161870.description: In the game Flying Kung-Fu Frogs, players try to launch their colored frogs onto the game base's spinning platforms to score points. Each platform is worth a different point value from 10 to 40 points. If you land on a gray base or get stuck on a branch, you score no points. If your frog lands on the table or anywhere besides the game base, pick it up and try again. To launch a frog, press down on its rear to fling it forward. As your finger slips off, the frog should jump toward the platforms. Once all frogs are somewhere on the game base, the game ends. Count up your points, and the player with the most points wins. This game is for two to four players. It comes with a Kung Fu Training Center game base, 20 frogs (five of each color), and a sticker sheet.

161871.description:
Potions Class is a press-your-luck dice game where players compete to be the top student in potions class. Be the first to reach 100 points and end the class with a higher score than anyone else to win. Of course in a potions class students can also craft concoctions to give themselves an edge on the other students.

Roll matching symbols to rack up points but if you press it too much you may end up failing the testing and getting none of the points, and fizzling any partially crafted potions.

Class is in session.

161877.name: Freedom Wars
161877.description:
Freedom Wars takes place on Earth, in the year 102013. The world surface lies in ruins and is no longer capable of supporting life. As such, humans live in underground cities called "Panopticons", where they struggle to research how to be able to live on the surface once more. A Panopticon functions as an artificial nation in the form of a city state that provides security for its inhabitants, in exchange for contributions each inhabitant is obligated to make towards the state. This system forms the overall societal structure of each separate Panopticon, which were created following the disintegration and demise of countries. Due to lack of resources, each Panopticon has developed conflicts with others, and large portions of the populace are forced into serving sentences in order for these cities to maintain effective control. All inhabitants of a Panopticon are constantly watched by the state to ensure they abide by the draconian laws put into place, essentially forming a collective of dystopian surveillance societies at war with one another.

Source: Wikipedia, "Freedom Wars," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

From the Publishers Blurb

The Rifter® #66 offers a variety of source material, monsters, baddies and information. All wonderful fodder for weaving your own adventures regardless of the setting. Plus great art, news, coming attractions, and more.
Every issue of The Rifter® is an idea factory for players and Game Masters to generate new ideas, and find new avenues of adventure. It provides useful, ready to go, source material you can just drop into your ongoing games. A doorway to new possibilities and numerous Palladium role-playing worlds. And the many new characters, O.C.C.s, powers, magic, weapons, villains, monsters, adventures and ideas for one setting can be easily adapted to any Palladium setting. Every issue has material for Rifts® and at least 2-3 other Palladium game lines.
The Rifter® Number 66 includes:
Heroes Unlimited™ – Bite of the Snake-Men – by Glen Evans. An HU2 adventure and a new batch of bad guys to battle.
Splicers® – Bestiary – by Edward Sauerland. A selection of strange creatures, monster creation tables and rules, the Ranger O.C.C. and more. Art by Chuck Walton.
Rifts® – Black Market: Rise to Power, Part Two – by Max Kautsch. Source material on the Black Market town of Singer, plus notable characters and some Black Market TW weapons.
Rifts® Phase World®/Three Galaxies™: Space Pirates – by Braden Campbell. The title pretty much says it all: Space Pirates. What more do you need?
