161633.name: The Táin
161633.description:
The Táin is a card driven wargame game for two players based on the Táin Bó Cúailnge or The Cattle Raid of Cooley. This is an epic story of early Irish Literature. It tells of a war against Ulster by the Connacht queen Medb and her husband Ailill, who intend to steal the bull Donn Cuailnge, opposed only by the Ulster hero Cuchulain.

Can Cuchulain hold off an entire army single-handedly or will Medb’s warriors win the day?

The Object of the Game
Cuchulain must slay three of Queen Meb’s chosen champions to win. If he dies before he does this Queen Medb wins.

Turn Order
Cuchulain begins with 6 Battle Cards in hand, Queen Medb with 5 Battle Cards. The game is played in alternating turns, beginning with Queen Medb. A turn consists of two phases: Support and Combat.

On a player’s turn they will first Support

1. Draw back to 5 or 6 Battle Cards in hand depending upon the player. Shuffle the discard deck if necessary to create a new Draw Deck. If a player has more than their starting number of cards in hand, they do not draw new ones. Players always draw cards to replenish their hand at the start of their turn.

2. The player may then choose to:

Play one Battle Card from hand as an Event, either discarding the card or removing (in this case the card will state it is to be removed)
or
Discard one or more Battle Cards from hand for action points, marking the Action Points (AP) on the respective track.
or
Play one Battle Card from hand as an Attack or Defense Stat Boost. The card is placed horizontally to the right of Cuchulain or Medb’s Champion, aligning with their base Attack and Defense values. In subsequent turns, additional cards may also boost these stats. Overlap each card so that the values can be read horizontally.
or
Play one Battle Card from hand to Heal, discarding the card. This option may only be chosen by Cuchulain

3. Then, if the player chooses to, they may Combat as the Attacker

4. When the Combat phase has ended, discard all cards played the Combat Lines to their respective discard decks.

The Devout: You are committed to spreading hope and restoring people’s faith in humanity.
The Dilettante: You are rich, usually idle, and often indulge in pastimes the poor only dream of.
The Doctor: You are a trained, rationally-minded physician, capable of treating the illnesses and injuries of the human body.
The Heir: You are an everyman who has recently come into a windfall.
The Journalist: You are an investigative reporter with a keen eye and nose out for the next big story.
The Professor: You are a teacher, a speaker, a walking body of knowledge.
The Salesman: You are a peddler, a huckster, a smooth-talking trader.




The rules necessary to treat the mind (Alienist) and body (Doctor) are included as well.

161635.name: playbook set I: flexible thinkers
161635.description:
From publisher blurb:

This set features archetypes with the capacity to think beyond the rigid bounds of polite company. Each possesses their own unique abilities, enabling them to deal with the darkness in their own way.

The Adventurer: You react to situations with raw physicality and unequaled training.
The Entertainer: You know how to wear masks and see beyond them.
The Handyman: You view problems as nails, to be bent, battered, or hammered back in place.
The Librarian: You find solace and secrets in books, and know full well knowledge is the ultimate power.
The Scientist: You are a man of science, who can unravel the world’s mysteries, given the proper equipment and enough time.

161636.name: playbook set II: on the fringes
161636.description:
From publisher blurb:

This set of archetypes lies in the grey limbo between logic and madness. Their thoughts and deeds often transgress the normal bounds of society, providing them with unequaled perspectives that saner, more rational minds might dismiss out of hand.

The Artist: You find inspiration in emotion and dream, and seek to share what you find with others through your chosen medium.
The Criminal: You proudly live on the wrong side of the law. Always have, always will. Until someone or something drives you down into your own private hell.
The Dreamer: You have learned there is a world of dream, a world beyond our own, and you seek out knowledge there to aid you in your waking hours.
The Drifter: You are an outcast, a homeless vagabond who has learned things most would dismiss out of hand from walking the dusty byways of the world.
The Psychic: You possess a gift, an ability to see through your third eye and to know the unknowable, and this makes people afraid of you.

161637.name: playbook set III: madmen
161637.description:
From publisher blurb:

This set of archetypes may operate within the realms of polite society, but they are apart from it. They have been touched and scarred by genius, madness, magic, or even the cold, dead hand of the Mythos, giving them singular gifts to serve them in driving back the darkness.

The Chosen: You have been touched by dark powers, and you must resist their siren call, lest the world devour itself.
The Escapee: Prisoner, inmate, special guest, the words all meant the same. You were caged until just recently, and now you must stay always one step ahead.
The Inventor: Your gift for making things transcends the norm. Your mind is off-kilter, and you embrace this as the very definition of genius.
The Sorcerer: You are trained in the practical application of the occult and have powers most would consider impossible at best, and more likely, obscenely monstrous.
The Veteran: War has taken its toll upon you, devouring bits of your soul upon the battlefield. You muddle on, though you’re certain the war continues.

161638.name: the cemetery: a playset expansion for Ebon Eaves
161638.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ebon Eaves is the creepy little town for you to call your own, but even nooks and crannies have nooks and crannies. This playset expansion enables you, the Keeper, to quickly and easily incorporate a cemetery (along with its surrounding mysteries) into their town, taking your group’s story into wickedly worrisome directions.

Included are three new playbooks, each with an appropriately macabre motif, and a particular talent to add to any party.

The Bereaved: You have lost a loved one and now mourn, even as the shadows seek to surround you.
The Gravedigger: You spend your life amongst the tombstones and the dead. How long before you join them?
The Mortician: A counselor, a consoler, and one who profits from others’ misery.

161640.name: Questrun
161640.description:
You like RPGs but don’t care about dialogues and scenarii ? QuestRun is for you! Run through various dungeons in this “Tactical Hack’n’Slash”, try to go as far as possible, die in agony and try again! Try new strategies, new heroes, choose new …

Source: The Developer Website.

161641.name: Nice Things for Fighters
161641.description:
From publisher blurb:

Move Your Martials Up a Tier!

For too long, the humble fighter and his ilk have been restricted, limited, nerfed, and outshone by high-level spellcasters in more ways than one. The groundbound swordmaster looked on in dismay as his wizard companion rained down Save or Dies on the enemies with Overland Flight. Huge monsters with superior reach and Combat Maneuver Bonuses towered over mortal adventurers as their disarms and trips failed to affect them, all the while provoking Attacks of Opportunity. Spells could be added and swapped by prepared casters whereas martials got feats and class features locked-in at their levels. Long-duration flight, attacks that target saves, area of effect attacks, incorporeal and invisible opponents, and other common dangers largely remain within the domain of spellcasters to use and solve.

If you pine for a sourcebook where noncasting martial characters get a nice, versatile assortment of toys, then this book is for you! Twenty-six pages of new feats, archetypes, traits, and artwork add new dimensions to martial builds for PCs and NPCs alike!

Throw large objects at your enemies with Herculean Strength!
Become a Grappling Cord Acrobat and zip around the battlefield!
Effect and attack incorporeal opponents with Undead Slayer!
Jump so high you may as well be flying with Dancing On the Wind!
Interfere with an enemy’s spellcasting with a mean look and the Spellfoil feat!
Full attack and move at the same time with Mobile Onslaught!




These are but a few of the available options contained within this tome! What are you waiting for? Get some cool presents for your campaign’s warriors with Nice Things for Fighters!

161642.name: A Time of War Quick-Start Rules (Free RPG Day 2014 Edition)
rpg: A Time of War: The BattleTech RPG
161642.description:
User summary:

Quick-start rules for the Battletech: A Time of War RPG, including a short adventure, Character Assassination, and four pre-generated characters.

It is bundled together with Shadowrun Quick-Start Rules (Free RPG Day 2014 Edition).

161643.description:
User summary:

Quick-start rules for the 5th edition for Shadowrun, including a new adventure for Free RPG Day 2014, Spoiled Rotten, and four pre-generated characters.

It is bundled together with A Time of War Quick-Start Rules (Free RPG Day 2014 Edition).

161645.name: Mor-Fun Stock Exchange Game
161645.description:
In 1936, the Universal Games Company of St. Louis, Mo. published the Mor-Fun Stock Exchange game. It was a bit out of the ordinary as the game board was made of 1/4" thick pressed board stock and had a long heavy metal spinner that spun on bearings. The lowest cost 'Home Model' sold for $5, which was a lot for a game in the 1930s. By comparison, the very popular game of Monopoly retailed for $2.00.

There was no scrip or play money with the game, the only trading was done with stock shares. The players trade stocks; the amount traded and the profit is determined by spinning the metal spinner then throwing the dice.

Each player is assigned a player number and in turn is a 'buyer' and spins the indicator bar. The player whose number the indicator lands on is the 'seller'. The number of stock shares will be shown under the players number where the indicator stops. The 'seller' then rolls the dice to determine the amount of profit the 'buyer' must pay for the stock shares. Multiply the number thrown on the dice by the number of shares to be transacted equals the amount of shares the 'buyer' must pay the 'seller'.

In addition, there are 'Futures', Margins', and the 'Pit' where players may be required to put shares of stock that can subsequently be won by any player as described in the rules.

The player who acquires the most stock at the end of the game wins. A player who runs out of stocks is eliminated from the game and play continues to an agreed upon time.

There is no scrip or game money, all transactions are completed with shares of stock.

161647.name: Superheroes
161647.description:
Two games in one.
In the first game, the players are superheroes and try to reach the last square marked with a M, during the race the villains try to stop the superheroes. The player who arrives first wins.
In the second game, the doctor octopus try to reach the M square before spiderman capture him.

161649.name: Escape from Fairyland
161649.description:
When I woke up, I was trapped in a book. I was inside the kingdom of fairy tales! I had to act quickly, in cooperation with the friends I met there, to plan my escape from that world. However, only one person could make it out safely...

To start the game, each player is dealt 1 fairy tale "heroine card" (Cinderella, Snow White, etc.) and 1 "attendant card." Using the abilities listed on these cards, as well as other cards drawn throughout the game, players attempt to collect heart pieces, create a heart key, and escape from Fairyland together with their attendant before other players manage to do so. Remember, only one person can ESCAPE from FAIRYLAND!!!

161650.name: D24 Wrestling Starter Set
161650.description:
D24 Wrestling can be played with one to four players. It combines the elements of dice rolling (with a D24 die!) action, strategy, role play and simulation into one awesome package, with matches taking place in real-time!

D24 Wrestling features faces (good guys), heels (bad guys), combining for a total of 20 unique playing cards. Each card has a full color illustration on the front, and game play stats on the back. We have main event stars (like Superbandit, Goliath, all the way down to low carders like Tadpole). The unpredictability of the D24 die adds to the "anything can happen" feel of the game!

There are two versions of the game: basic and advanced. A "basic" match begins when two players roll the d24 to see which wrestler will start on offense. The player that gained control will then roll on his wrestler's offensive set (each wrestler has 24 moves, including their finisher(s)! For the offensive wrestler to stay in control, he must roll successfully vs. the skill rating (power, speed, technical, brawling, aerial and striking). The offensive wrestler loses control when he does not roll successfully vs. his skill rating; then the opponent takes over on offense (just like a real match!). When a wrestler hits their finisher, the opponent must roll their 3-Count or Submission Rating, plus the opponent's finisher rating, to see if he is defeated. If the opponent rolls their 3-Count Rating or below, the match is over and the opponent wins (there are also other random ways to win, such as pin scenarios on the "Into the Ropes Action Chart").

The advanced game turns up the heat with more strategy options and player input. The advanced game allows a wrestler to attempt pins up to three times during the course of a match. Strength of moves is taken into account (some moves are more damaging than others). Maximum Damage Points from close pins/submission attempts, and finishers indicate how hurt a wrestler is, including blood! The advanced game also allows for wrestlers to use steel chairs and other foreign objects...but be careful, a disqualification may result! Other options found in the advanced version: exiting the ring, suicida moves, finisher counters, submission wrestling--you have four turns to get out of a basic submission move, and three for a submission finisher--or you tap out!

The game comes complete with a storyline that also allows you to take on the role of owner/booker/promoter and run your own version of WOX! Crown champions, develop feuds, determine rankings, create TV and house shows that culminate in pay per views! Schedule tournament and play nights or focus on the storyline element of the game...you're in charge!

161651.name: ASAT: Orbital Combat
161651.description:
ASAT is a board game of orbital combat in the foreseeable future. Pilot your spacecraft against other spacecraft in Earth’s orbit, using simple but accurate orbital physics rules.

ASAT is a PnP, low complexity war game game of space combat in Earth orbit. As your ship orbits the Earth, use celestial mechanics, and your ship's thrust, sensors, and weapons to close in, target, and attack your opponent - before they do the same to you!

Players control one or more ships orbiting the Earth in one of several discrete orbits. Turns are meant to simulate simultaneous action. On each turn, (a) the players (optionally) move using thrust, or let the ships continue in their present orbit, (b) attempt to locate and detect an enemy using sensors, (c) once a detection is successful, attack the opposing ship using weapons, and (d) defend against attacks and tally up inflicted damage.

The game continues until one player's ships are destroyed, or one player is able to retreat by de-orbiting and successfully re-entering the atmosphere to land on Earth.

161652.name: The One Ring Roleplaying Game
rpghonor: 2014 Golden Geek Best RPG Artwork/Presentation Nominee
rpgissuearticle: Marhathiuda - The Horsefolk of Northern Rhovanion
161652.description:
Publisher Blurb

Smaug has been defeated, the Battle of Five Armies has been won, and Bilbo has returned to the Shire. But much danger still remains, and from the Orc-holds of the mountains to the dark and corrupt depths of Mirkwood a darkness waits, recovering its strength, laying its plans, and slowly extending its shadow . . .

The One Ring™ Roleplaying Game is the newest fantasy roleplaying game set in the world of The Hobbit™ and The Lord of the Rings™, allowing you and your friends to set out on your own adventures in Middle-earth.

This new edition combines the Adventurer's Guide and Loremaster's Guide of the previous, award-winning, slipcase edition into a single volume, reformatted and re-edited for ease of use at the gaming table.

This game contains:


A complete set of rules for roleplaying in Middle-earth
How to create characters and make your own fellowship
A bestiary of enemies to face, from Giant Spiders and Orcs to Stone-trolls and Wargs
Advice for telling stories that evoke the spirit of The Hobbit™ and The Lord of the Rings™
Six ready-made characters and a complete adventure to get started right away


You just need a group of players, a 12-sided die, and a handful of 6-sided dice to play!


User Description

A single-volume revision of the 2011 two-volume slipcase edition. The PDF contains 332 numbered pages, plus the front cover and 3 pages of advertisements. The Adventurer's Map and Loremaster's Map come as separate PDFs and are included with purchase.

161681.description:
Lift Off! Get Me Off This Planet! is a fast-paced, "gateway" game where you use the moon and spacecrafts to get your Aliens off the planet before it explodes!

The game has a casual space theme and never takes itself too seriously. Lift Off! Get Me Off This Planet! is easy to learn, fast-paced game, where everyone feels engaged and "in it" until someone has won or the planet explodes!

The objective of Lift Off! Get Me Off This Planet! is to be the first player to get their Aliens off the planet using resource cards, action cards, and phases of the moon to escape. If the planet explodes before everyone escapes, the player with the most saved Aliens wins.

What’s special about Lift Off! Get me off this Planet is that lift off points (space vehicles) are all different and often require multiple players to work together to take off. For example, a rocket ship takes a lot of resources and can carry 6 aliens from various players. This creates a great dynamic where initially all players are working together to get, say, the first half of their aliens off the planet, but once it starts thinning people become more competitive and tricky about things using action cards to manipulate the moon, change the board, create tornadoes, etc.

Fast & Furious dogfights during the Great War.

Le Temps des As (Age of Aces) is a tactical game featuring aerial combats from 1917-1918 during World War One.
The system allows dogfights with several aircrafts in a reduced game time, with minimal markings on the map and requiring no pre-plotting or card play.
The game focuses on dogfights and features rules for bombing and balloon-busting.

Le Temps des As (Age of Aces) can be played solo or with 2 or more players.

161684.description:
Publisher Blurb

Can you survive the Spire? Get the most out of Pathfinder Module: The Emerald Spire Superdungeon with this custom-made assortment of characters, treasures, and more! Item Cards help you track all the best items and equipment, Face Cards depict the most important NPCs, and new Quest Cards summarize key adventure goals to keep players on track. Designed specifically for use with Pathfinder Module: The Emerald Spire Superdungeon, this beautifully illustrated 54-card deck is sure to help you conquer one of the deadliest dungeons ever imagined!

161685.name: Thunderclap
161685.description:
From publisher blurb:

THUNDERCLAP!

With the power of a storm, Thunderclap has found his way to your campaign and isn't pleased with how your heroes are defending it. Bringing his own form of order with him, can the heroes of your campaign stop him from taking over?

161686.name: Catacombs
161686.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Product is a 40 x 40 inch, full color battlemap of a Catacomb.

The Product comes with the Square, Hex and No Overlay versions and the Virtual Tabletop Maps.

“How does it feel knowing you came to steal from the dead only to join them?”

Enter DramaScape's Catacombs at your own peril for only the Game Master knows what lurks inside! Well-lit catacomb rooms in the center are enveloped by haunting shadows and unlit areas around the edge of the map to create a gloomy atmosphere. As if the torches and candles inside the rooms could be snuffed out at any time by the surrounding darkness.

The product is an internal view map of an underground dungeon.

The product is intended for use in fantasy or horror games. Many catacombs still exist today, allowing for its use in modern games as well as the place of hiding for a secret cult or a smuggling operation below the city.

Adventure hook for use with this product.

Stolen Lives: The catacombs have been robbed of almost everything of value. A vampire discovered the place as he sought cover from the outstretching rays of light as the sun began to rise. He found the decor to his liking and even a crypt to sleep in. He was even more delighted when would be thieves arrived to rob the catacombs allowing him to occasionally "eat in".

With each slain thief, his sired ranks grew and he decided to put the skills of his new peons to use. He sent them out to gather objects to further decorate the catacombs and grab more people to snack on. He even had them spread rumors of a new guild of thieves in the catacombs to bring them more food and to bolster their ranks.

The Player Characters can get involved by either seeking to join this new thieves' guild or by investigating the recent rash of disappearances in the city at night.

161687.name: The Fugue System
161687.description:
From publisher blurb:

A simplistic rules system for any genre. The fugue system was created to allow a flowing story driven roleplaying experience, without a lot of dice rolls and calculations. The fugue system uses a 2D6 + Skill Or attribute vs Target number for resolutions.

161688.name: Magic System
161688.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Fugue Magic system, created for use with the "Fugue system", allows open creative spells and caster types!

There are four parts to the magic system in fugue. They are,

Magic cliché: - Explains the type of magic used.
Spell casting: - Skill used to cast, learn and create spells.
Spells: Name
Info: What the spell does.

161689.name: The Fugue System in 4 Pages
161689.description:
User summary:

A quick overview of how The Fugue System works.

161690.name: The Farmhouse
161690.description:
From Introduction:

A quick introductory adventure for Fugue System.
This is intended to allow new players to understand the rules and how the game is played, before heading off into a campaign. campaign cliché: Standard fantasy setting (fair +0)
Farmer joe has asked the players to go into his storm cellar and kill the Giant Spider that has taken up residence there.

161691.name: Silvoworn: A World of Magic and Mystery
161691.description:
From Introduction:

The characters should all be Modern Day. Each character is a College student, each graduating shortly, with masters in a subject. Each hurled into Silvoworn by means of trickery.

The trickery performed by a zealot group from Silvoworn that needs outsiders to help their world, for the evil that has surrounded the town of Asylum knows there thoughts, but cannot read those of other worlds, so they hope.

One by one, each character is hurled into Silvoworn.

161692.name: Heroic Tails
161692.description:
From Introduction:

If you're reading this, you probably know what the Redwall Abbey books are, and it's likelyyou've read them. If not, I direct you to the official website, Redwall.org, and shortly thereafter to a library. Regardless of whether you want to play Heroic Tails, you should begiving the books a try.

Now, assuming you understand Redwall, you're halfway there. All that's left is to describe the RPG side of things, and you should be moving along quite nicely.

161693.name: Sounds of SSSilence
161693.description:
From Introduction:

It is the first feast of the summer in amber-dale glen. First, everything is fun and lighthearted. However, now a few dibbuns have gone missing… Where are they?

A Snake, not ready to devour them yet, has captured the dibbuns, the snake has left three toads to guard them. The toads are unwilling servants of the snake, wishing they could get away, but knowing that the snake could track them down.

The elders of Amber-dale glen have chosen to search for the dibbuns. They have created parties of townsfolk to search; the PC’s are such a party.

The PCs will meet up with the snake; or, will they find the dibbuns and think that the toads captured them?

161694.name: Fugue Fudge
161694.description:
User summary:

A modification for the Fudge rules which would eventually become The Fugue System.

161695.name: By the Whisker
161695.description:
From Introduction:

"The forest came to life as Quickpaw woke from his leaf bed under the tall elm. Overhead he could here the squabbling of some sparra. The sun creped further into the sky, and without eating Quickpaw started out toward Amber-dale glen. He carried with him a burden, an icy shard in his heart. Amberdale glen had only been around for 5 seasons.
"Three days ago Quickpaw had over heard a few now dead toad warriors explaining very excitedly about the Great War to overthrow the Woodlanders and over take the Amber-Works. There great leader GrugUg had devised the plan, and as Quickpaw listened, the more his heart sank. Now he is headed off to let the dwellers of Amber-dale glen know what’s about to come…"
By the Whisker is a Role-playing Setting.
It's based on the Redwall books by Brian Jacques.
For Use with any Universal Role-playing game.

161697.name: The Demise of Watchman Island
161697.description:
From the Introduction:

An outpost on Watchman Island (in Troskenia) will soon be swallowed up by the growing Etunakaimas, the world of the ettins, and be lost to man unless someone is able to halt the ettin power. The outpost has run out of men able and brave enough to venture into Etunakaimas in search for what causes it to grow, so they have sent arrows to the nearby settlements with request for aid, and the heads of the families of the player characters have decided that this is a good opportunity for them to prove themselves as real men.

161698.name: To Be Emperor
161698.description:
Three hundred years ago, the wandering tribe of Scragen settled at the shores of the Pentibar Sea. Over the decades, the settlement grew to be a great city and from it was born the thriving Empire of Vistos.

Today, Vistos faces a unique challenge. Astemaed, 12th Emperor of the greatest empire the world has ever seen, has died without an heir. By law, it falls on the senate to elect his successor. Very few candidates are worthy in the eyes of the senate. You are among them. Through strength, cunning and the power of your wealth, you must persuade the senate to your side and thwart your rivals' attempts to do the same.

No higher seat of power exists, no greater title than Emperor of Vistos. Who's coin shall ring the loudest? Who's might shall overcome? Who's knowledge shall prove greatest? The world watches and waits as you attempt... To Be Emperor.

To Be Emperor is a strategy card game of bidding and resource management. By winning bids on Assets, you gain the resources necessary to maintain Senators you have won to your side as well as to affect game play. By winning bids on Senators, you bring yourself closer to victory. The first player to have persuaded Senators to their side worth 10 or more Influence in the senate is the next Emperor of Vistos. Take care, though. Bid too greedily on senators or use up your resources with haste and you may find the Senators in your pocket seeking deeper pockets elsewhere.

In the files section are PDF and zip files with the rules and all the cards ready for print and play. You will only need to provide tokens (five per player, a different color for each player). All I ask is that you contact me with any constructive criticism and ideas, how many games you played, how many players and how long for each game.

161699.description:
The officially licensed Tiffin Games' Strategic and Tactical Objectives counter sheet

This adds variety and new depth to OGRE games. It includes a selection of strategic and tactical objective buildings, including castle, a seabase, a missile silo, a satellite array, a rail exchange, dome facilities, a Military HQ, a port to name a few, with "damaged/destroyed" versions on the reverse side.

It also contains six "Archangel" class GEV-Mobile Command Posts, in Combine, Paneuro, Black Rose and Ogre: Nightfall rogue AI faction colors, together with biohazard/radioactive status counters, and more.

This product is one sheet of 32 double sided counters
161699.name: Ogre: Strategic & Tactical Objectives Sponsored Counter Sheet

161700.description: This sheet (R1) includes Paneuropean units themed from the classic G.E.V. game. It includes 7 bonus 3-D counters (including Fencer and Fencer-B cybertanks), a 3-D Reactor Building (unit not included in the base box), and more!
161700.name: Ogre: ACD Distribution Sponsored Counter Sheet

161701.name: Zenith (1982)
161701.description:
User Summary
Your mission is to defend the city of Zenith while it is under construction. Destroy any flying objects over the city and repair any damages.

161702.name: Flowers of Hell: The Demon Players Guide
rpgpublisher: CCP Games / CCP hf (Crowd Control Productions)
161702.description:
From publisher blurb:

I want to be human, sometimes.

I think about what they have and how simple it all must be.

Even if they aren't sure of their identities, at least for them the question is multiple choice.

A human can only be so many different things.

But to really survive after the Fall, you have to let go of everything, including identity.

It has to be constantly changing.

That's the only way you can stay hidden - never give the Machine something to zero in on.

-Comrade West

Flowers of Hell: The Demon Players Guide expands on the material presented in Demon: The Descent, with additional information on the Agendas, the Unchained condition and mindset, and how the reason for the Fall - the catalyst - affects game play and character development. You'll also find rules for suborning Infrastructure and what kinds of risks and rewards it brings.

The book also includes a plethora of new Embeds, Exploits, demonic form abilities, and Merits, as well as an entire chapter on Gadgets and how they can make your demon's Descent easier...or at least, much more interesting.

161703.name: Tales of the Crescent City
rpghonor: 2014 Golden Geek Best RPG Supplement Nominee
161703.description:
From the back of the book:

It is an old city with a colorful, often tragic history, a place where different races, cultures, and religions meet, sometimes blending and other times clashing. It is a city rich in the arts, where music and food are celebrations of life. Yet beneath it all, there is another city, a haunted place where mysterious cults worship in the surrounding swamps, sagging plantations hide terrifying secrets, and the sins of the past do not stay silent or unanswered. The dark and dangerous powers of the Cthulhu Mythos are woven thickly into the tapestry of the Crescent City; they have always been and always will be.

But through it all, there have been a few brave and hardy souls who fought against these sinister forces. Many of them fall in this crusade, their bodies broken, their spirits corrupted, their minds unhinged by the horrors they face. Because of their struggles and sacrifices, the Crescent City is protected, and the blasphemous horrors beyond human understanding are kept a bay... at least for now...

These are a few of their tales.

161704.description:
The Dice Manipulation and Strategy Game about Cyber Threats in the 21st Century.

ZERO Hour: Cyberspace is a game about creating and managing Cyber Threats in the 21st Century.

This is accomplished by using the innovative ZERO HOUR GAME SYSTEM.
The ZERO HOUR GAME SYSTEM uses twenty-four sided (D24) dice that you as the player will manipulate and move as playing pieces through the course of the game.

This is the first in a series of unique games that will utilize the
ZERO HOUR GAME SYSTEM in order to create a myriad of game experiences with one basic rules structure that you as players can expand to your liking.

The objective of each Player is to maneuver their Code Dice thru The Network (game board), and place two of their five Code Dice into any opposing active Player(s) Source space on the game board.

The game ends once one player achieves the objective of having two Code Dice in any opposing active Player(s) Source space. That player is immediately declared the Winner.

Alternatively, if all Players have a Terminated Hard Line, the game ends immediately. The Winner of the game is the player with the highest value showing on a Code Die in an opposing Player’s Source space.

The Winner of the Game is the player with the highest value showing on a Code Die in an opposing Player’s Source space.
161704.name: ZERO Hour: Cyberspace

161705.name: Namco Classic (Golf)
161705.description:
User Summary

A golf game for the Game Boy, which is similar to Mario Golf. Namco's classic golf was also ported to the NES.

161706.name: Wayward Board Game
161706.description:
Wayward is a "choose your own adventure" style of game where you race to collect the most gold before the guards sound the alarm and try to trap you in the dungeon forever!

There are many ways to collect gold, such as battling in the fighting pit, stealing from the king's treasure room, digging up graves, or slugging your way through the bar brawl. Avoid the river squid or he may take your items! The risks you take can pay off with great rewards - or losses.

Items you pick up help you push past guards, pass through hazards, open locked doors, and increase your luck at collecting treasure. See if you can discover the best path to winning the game and escaping the dungeon!

161707.name: Sanasokkelo
161707.description: Sanasokkelo (which means word labyrinth) is Finnish word game. Game consist of circular board, which has four rings of letter spaces and one letter space in the middle. Nearby letter spaces are connected with lines. There is 73 of these rounded holes in the board. At the start of every game you will randomize cardboard letter tiles to these holes. Now you decide how long you will play and turn around the board. Then everybody tries to make words with letters, that are connected with lines. When you find a word (at least four letters long), you shout it and collect the points. You get one point for every letter in the word you found. You get special points, if you can use the letter in the middle or letters in the third (red) circle. When time runs out, the player with most points is the winner. The game can be played in any language, which have approximately same letter distribution in words as in Finnish.

161708.name: Anonima Gidierre (Numero 23 - Settembre/Ottobre 1999)
rpgissuearticle: 1° trofeo "Eroi in campo" di Blood Bowl

161709.name: Neon Sanctum Playtest Kit
161709.description:
Publisher blurb:

Neon Sanctum is a tactical card based role-playing game set in a deadly cyberpocalypse world. In the game your characters are made from a deck of cards rather than a character sheet. The use of cards means Neon Sanctum is a great first step into the immersive world of RPGs for those who are familiar with board and cards games whilst still providing depth and challenge.

Take on the role of a heroic character you create, in a world where dystopian cyberpunk cities are surrounded by mutant-filled wastelands, and corporations control the people.

This version of the game includes everything 5 players (1DM, 4 players) need to try out the game absolutely free.

The Print n Play includes:

The Rulebook (71 pages)
The cards (72, which is 8 A4 pages)
A book with adventures for players to enjoy (33 pages)
Three custom battle maps

user comment
the Playtest Kit contains several PDFs for a total of 118 pages

161710.name: Anonima Gidierre (Numero 24 - Novembre/Dicembre 1999)
rpgissuearticle: Il mago rosso, il mago blu
La trilogia di Tolkien al cinema

161711.description:
Beasts of Burden is a quick-playing card game of treachery and debauchery for 2-6 people.

The central theme and mechanic of the game is managing encumbrance:

You and your backstabbing pals can only carry so much stuff yet, you will need certain treasures, tools, and weapons to survive monsters, traps, and puzzles. For example, Party Orcs can be defeated with either weapons or a barrel of brandy, while the Monster That Can Only Be Defeated By Flaming Arrows can only be defeated by... uh... flaming arrows.

Each player has a hand of 7 cards, drawn from the deck. There are three categories of cards, Items, Encounters and Effects.

You can only have 10 weight worth of weapon, tool, treasure and container cards in front of you, but you'll need a variety of item cards to defeat monster, quest and puzzle cards that are played in a 3x3 grid in the center of the table. Encounter cards are worth points, and the person with the most points after one of the four quests has been completed wins.

Throw in some fiendish traps and game-altering effects, and you have a table full of mayhem as players juggle weapons, treasure and sacks full of kittens as they navigate an increasingly absurd dungeon.
161711.name: Beasts of Burden

161712.name: Anonima Gidierre (Numero 25 - Gennaio/Febbraio 2000)
rpgissuearticle: Cerchi lavoro? Nuove classi per il Richiamo di Cthulhu
Giochi di ruolo dal vivo: fantasia o realtà? Entrambe! (prima parte)
Le razze di Blood Bowl: i goblinoidi
Ryusei l'Implacabile e Keiji il Magnifico
Tra le nebbie del tempo (prima parte)

161713.name: Anonima Gidierre (Numero 26 - Marzo/Aprile 2000)
rpgissuearticle: Giochi di ruolo dal vivo: fantasia o realtà? Entrambe! (parte seconda)
Tra le nebbie del tempo (seconda parte)

161714.name: Anonima Gidierre (Numero 27 - Estate 2000)
rpgissuearticle: E se Anonima Gidierre non fosse mai esistita?
Giochi di ruolo dal vivo: fantasia o realtà? Entrambe! (parte terza)
Tra le nebbie del tempo (terza  parte)

161715.name: Little Protector Planes
161715.description:
User Summary

Little Protector Planes is an RPG with an emphasis on cutesy graphics and your enemies include for example 'bad sheep'. You assemble a team of adventurers and set off to defeat evil on different planes. You have a limited number of turns to explore the world and can take up quests, explore dungeons, fight evil shrines and purchase better equipment with gold that you find. If you complete quests additional characters may be tempted to join your party. Combat is automatically carried out but you can influence the fight by casting spells and choosing when to use potions. Experience gains result in your characters levelling-up.

161716.name: The Lost City of Barakus (Swords & Wizardry)
161716.description:
From the Back Cover:

Centuries ago, a race of humans built an elaborate underground city beneath the Duskmoon Hills called Barakus. These were a magic-loving people, and for hundreds of years they dwelled peacefully in their subterranean home, delving into the arcane arts. Eventually, however, one of their number, a necromancer named Devron, rose to great power and transformed himself into a lich. The wizards of Barakus banded together, and after a great struggle, banished him to a prison far below the city. Before his banishment, however, Devron forged the helm of power, which he could eventually use [to] restore his power.

The Lost City of Barakus, designed to take characters from 1st to 6th level (or higher),m is as much a campaign setting as an adventure. Detailed within these pages is the great, bustling metropolis of Endhome, the Penprie Forest and Duskmoon Hills located north of the city, and, finally, the huge dungeon that is the Lost City of Barakus. Within all these areas are many adventures, NPCs, and locations for the party to explore, interact with and conquer. How and in what order the party chooses to take on the various challenges before them is entirely yours (the Referee's) and the player's choice.

161717.name: Caribbean Admiral
161717.description:
User Summary

An action adventure game where you play a former admiral attempting to get revenge on a ghost pirate ship in the Caribbean. You start off by attacking weaker pirate ships and looting their wrecks, then by selling the salvage and by shipping goods around you acquire more and better ships, and upgrade them, eventually becoming powerful enough to confront the ghost ship which thwarted you at the start of the game.

161718.name: The Arkham Gazette (Issue 0 - Aug 2013)
rpgissuearticle: Annotated Scenario Bibliography: the Aylesbury Pike
161718.description:
A prototype issue of the Arkham Gazette, a free e-zine focused on the Lovecraft Country setting for the Call of Cthulhu RPG.

This issue's topic was the Aylesbury Pike.

From publisher blurb of revised edition:

This issue of the Arkham Gazette was developed as a 'proof' of concept' test to see if the idea for a magazine focused on the Lovecraft Country setting for The Call of Cthulhu RPG was feasible and if there was interest. First released in August of 2013, this newly revamped version of the issue has been updated to our current format, the articles within have been revised, two pieces of artwork by Galen Pejeau added, and a new article has been included as well.

The theme for this issue is The Aylesbury Pike, the (fictional) road running between Arkham and Aylesbury, which forms a parallel backbone for Lovecraft Country along with the Miskatonic River.

Contents include:

New place: The Amos-Goodrich Cemetery
New England's Highways, an introduction
A History of the Aylesbury Pike
New person: Curtis Sloan, "Encyclopedia Salesman"
A Guide to New England's Petroglyphs and those found in Lovecraft Country
A short encounter - Mr. Picket Goes a Huntin'
**NEW** A scenario seed - The Phantom of the Aylesbury Pike
SCENARIO: "The Chapochaug Tunnel Haunting"
An annotated list of scenarios set on or near (or are otherwise connected to) the Aylesbury Pike.




A conversion guide for using this material with the 7th Edition Call of Cthulhu rules is forthcoming, as is a separate PDF of this issue's handouts.

161719.description:
Darkness looms on the horizon. Strange signs have started to appear all over the world: seas flecked with blood, flocks of shadowy figures wheeling in the sky, prophetic visions that leave people mumbling in addled madness. The time has finally come. The Old Ones are stirring, and it’s your job to wake them up!

In Rise of Cthulhu you play as the leader of a cultist faction wishing to awaken Cthulhu and the other Old Ones awaken to rule this world. But a competing faction races against you to be the first to awaken these chaotic masters. By playing various numbered and colored Cultist Cards, you must control the prime Lovecraftian locations – Arkham, Dunwich, Innsmouth and Kingsport – in an effort to awaken an Old One. The faction that maintains the most influence on a location will gain favor when the Old One arises, while the losing faction risks the destruction of their sanity and souls. Through clever pairing of colored and numbered cards, players can summon dangerous Monster Cards to their aid, unlock the eldritch secrets of lost Artifact Cards, and even manipulate an Unspeakable Guardian to terrorize your opponent. All of this and more await the cunning and adventurous in this tactical card game of influence and horror for 2 players.

On your turn you will have 2 actions: you can either draw 2 cards, play 2 cards from your hand, or draw a card and play a card. Cards can be drawn from a face down deck of Cultist cards or a face up pile of discarded Cultists cards, known as the Valley. Cards must be played on your side of one of the four main Lovecraftian locations - Arkham, Dunwich, Innsmouth and Kingsport. The player with the most total points on a given location turns the location to face them, marking that location as being influenced by their cultists. As the values change during gameplay, locations will shift their influence from player to player. Playing three of the same color, three of the same number, or a run of three cards of the same color (ex. 2-3-4 of green) will earn players the right to draw from special Monster and Artifact cards to help their hold on locations or hinder their opponent. At key points in the game, Old Ones will be drawn from the Cultist Deck and attach themselves to a location: the player currently influencing that location will reap the benefits of the Old One. When all three Old Ones awaken, the game ends and the person with the most locations facing them (or points in play if there's a tie) is the winner.
161719.name: Rise of Cthulhu
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 8 - The Best Decks Money Can Build

161720.name: Rumplestiltskin!
161720.description:
Based on the popular game concept of Werewolf and Mafia, Rumplestiltskin offers a re-imagined take with our Fairytale Games theme. Set as a party game best played with 6+ players, we've expanded upon the core mechanics and offer character traits, abilities, and spells you may use as either Rumplestiltskin, his clones or the villagers of Nottingham. You will play as well-known characters such as the Little Mermaid, Red Riding Hood, Briar Rose, Mad Hatter and more!

We, on the other hand have our twisted version called “Rumplestiltskin”. In this storyline, Rumplestilskin and his fellow imp have shapeshifted themselves into fairytale land. At night, they go out and murder random characters in order to use their life essence to make him even more powerful. The fairytale characters have gotten word about this and are working together to snuff him out and have him (and his imps) burn alive at the stake. But who can we really trust?

This is a group party game that’s about survival and wits. The Magic Mirror (the moderator) divides players into two secret teams – Team Rumplestiltskin (The two imps) and the Fairytale Characters. Team Rumplestilskin’s goal is to kill all of the victims before being discovered. The Fairytale Characters’ goal is to identify who is on Team Rumplestiltskin and vote to burn them alive.

Features:

42 Beautifully illustrated cards set in the Fairytale Games Universe)
New card mechanics - Traits
New card mechanics - Spells
New character abilities
Refreshing take on a classic game (werewolf/mafia)
NUMBER OF PLAYERS: 6-20 Players
GAME TIME: 30-90 Minutes

161722.name: d8 Magazine (Issue 1 - 1995)
rpgissuearticle: Green: Beyond the Alluring Thicket Basilisk

161723.name: Alaska!
161723.description:
"A Game of Travel... Adventures... Facts... Fun!"

Alaska! is an adventure game for the entire family. As you travel around the 49th state, you'll be collecting adventures and learning interesting facts about Alaskan history, geography and current events.

You travel around the state of Alaska to different destinations, collecting "adventures" as you go. Once you assemble a certain number of adventure sets, you return to Ketchikan. the first to do so wins.

161725.name: SpeeDeck
161725.description:
SpeeDeck includes a set of cards, chips, cubes, and a stick. With these simple components you can play 5 different and unique games:

1. Chicken Run (2 players - 15min)
Each player is the driver of a car hurtling toward their opponent. Two cards are played from the players' hands each turn to determine the car mileage and position in a wall of fog. Without hitting, who can get the closest? Who will blink first?!?

2. Best Pitching (3-4 players - 30min)
In this speedy trick-taking game, players take on the role of a baseball pitcher attempting to win a game! The number of tricks which can be taken in a single round is determined in advance. Players compete for the specified number of rounds to get the most points.

3. Tumbling Dust (3 players - 15min)
Attempt to read the hands of the other players or you'll be at the mercy of the strong winds! Players can change the wind strength, direction, and movement of other players with the goal of collecting the most wind blown garbage.

4. Document Sort (2 players - 5min)
This is a real-time card sorting race between two players. Players compete to make a set arranged in numerical order before their opponent. Quick judgment and hand speed will be needed to win!

5. Parachute Dive (1 player - 10min)
Sky diving solitaire! Is it possible to land safely by controlling your rate of fall!? This game is played in two rounds. In round one, the player attempts to successfully deploy their parachute. In round two, the player has to land with their feet on the ground! Good luck!

161726.name: Sword & Spear: Wargames Rules for Ancient and Medieval Battles
boardgamepodcastepisode: Meeples & Miniatures - Episode 142 - Sword & Spear
Meeples & Miniatures - Episode 160 - Sword & Spear 2nd Editon
161726.description:
Sword & Spear is a set of wargames rules for Ancients and Medieval battles. They are suitable for any scale figures and any basing standard, the only requirement being that figures are organized into units of equal frontage. A typical game has around 8—15 units on each side, and games take around two to three hours. The rules are designed from a top-down perspective, focusing on outcomes rather than detail.
Sword & Spear features a clever and innovative system for activating units that creates interesting and challenging decisions, keeps both players involved at all times, and has a lot of depth and subtlety. Each turn is split into phases, where players each receive a number of action dice, which are rolled and then used to activate their units. The number shown on each dice determines which units can activate (with better quality units being easier to activate), what the unit can do when activated, and also determine the activation sequence. Certain dice also give bonuses to combat, movement distance, or shooting range. So there is a lot to think about, and allocating the action dice well is the key to success (although rolling lots of sixes helps as well!).
The rules are relatively straightforward, and there are no "to hit" tables, charts, or lists of dieroll modifiers. They can be played using only the one-sided Quick Reference Sheet, with very little reference to the rulebook after the first couple of games.
Army lists are available as free downloads online, covering a wide range of Ancient and Medieval armies. These include points for each unit, so that players can play relatively balanced games by building armies to a set points total. There are currently over 40 army lists, including many of the most popular armies, and more are being added each week, with the aim to have over 100 lists available. The rules also include guidelines to help in recreating historic battles, and there are three generic scenarios included as alternatives to the pitched battle.
The strengths of the game are that it gives an exciting, interesting and challenging experience, plays relatively quickly for the size of battle that is being depicted, and the rules are straightforward to learn, whilst having the depth to retain interest after repeated play.

161727.name: Mystery Genre Charts
161727.description:
User Summary:

An expansion pack for The Covetous Poet's Adventure Creator and Solo GM Guidebook that adds charts for mystery-genre role-playing games.

From the Introduction:

The Mystery Genre Charts are for roleplaying games featuring clever detectives who use their uncommon skills and desire to stop crime to see justice done. Players who using games featuring sleuths, mysteries, and ingenious crimes should use these charts to create their adventures.

161728.name: Rivalry of Local Barons
161728.description:
Issue game of Wargame Japanese History #22.

Strategic level wargame for climax of the Japanese Sengoku period.
The basic game concept is inspired from History of the World, and has a shorter playtime and is simpler.

Each turn, players select one of six revealed warlord cards. The top order card can be taken free, but second or later card is require a "Heaven's will" chit. And these chits can be taken by the later chooser of the skipped cards.
Each warlord card has various strength and special ability, and also attached a support card.
The battle is resolved by a die with a very simple combat result table.

The winner is determined by victory points, earned for control of provinces and other bonuses.

161729.description:
Carcassonne is a tile-placement game in which the players draw and place a tile with a piece of southern French landscape on it. The tile might feature a city, a road, a cloister, grassland or some combination thereof, and it must be placed adjacent to tiles that have already been played, in such a way that cities are connected to cities, roads to roads, etcetera. Having placed a tile, the player can then decide to place one of his meeples on one of the areas on it: on the city as a knight, on the road as a robber, on a cloister as a monk, or on the grass as a farmer. When that area is complete, that meeple scores points for its owner.

During a game of Carcassonne, players are faced with decisions like: "Is it really worth putting my last meeple there?" or "Should I use this tile to expand my city, or should I place it near my opponent instead, giving him a hard time to complete his project and score points?" Since players place only one tile and have the option to place one meeple on it, turns proceed quickly even if it is a game full of options and possibilities.

This 2003 special edition comes in a metal box and contains the Carcassonne base game and the 2nd expansion Carcassonne: Expansion 2 – Traders & Builders.
161729.name: Carcassonne inklusive Händler & Baumeister

161730.description:
This expansion gives you a new perspective at the beginning of the game. Each Dungeon Setup Card depicts a different starting dungeon. Are you ready to establish a dungeon in an abandoned hideout or a natural cave? How about a diamond mine? Now when your imps are digging tunnels, they can also discover underground treasures!

-Taken from KS campaign for Dungeon Lords: Happy Anniversary, but the micro-expansion is to be offered as a separate module for all previous owners.
161730.name: Dungeon Lords: Dungeon-Setup Tiles

161731.name: GM's Miscellany: Urban Dressing
161731.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tired of your towns and cities being boring, bland places in which your PCs show little or no interest? Want to bring your towns and cities alive with cool, interesting minor features of note? Then GM’s Miscellany: Urban Dressing is for you! Presenting tons of cool, interesting features for common urban fixture such as shops, stalls, thieves and so on GM’s Miscellany: Urban Dressing provides the harried GM the tools to bring such features to life with interesting and noteworthy features. GM’s Miscellany: Urban Dressing presents the material originally appearing in:

Barroom Brawls
Dragon and the Thief
Random Urban Encounters
So What’s It Called, Anyway?
So What's For Sale, Anyway?
So What's For Sale, Anyway? II
So What's The Tavern Like, Anyway?
So What’s The Tavern Like, Anyway? II
Urban Dressing: Alleyways
Urban Dressing: Docks
Urban Dressing: Graveyards
Urban Dressing: Guildhalls
Urban Dressing: Market Stalls
Urban Dressing: Parks
Urban Dressing: Pirate Town
Urban Dressing: Sages
Urban Dressing: Shrines
Urban Dressing: Temples
Urban Dressing: Theatres
Urban Dressing: Thieves
Urban Dressing: The Watch
Urban Dressing: Traders & Craftsmen
New Material: More exciting encounters, as well as comprehensive details on monuments, ruined buildings and wizard’s towers

161732.name: River Isle
161732.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tommi Salama cartographer for Adventure Quarterly, and AdventureaWeek, presents the right map for your river exploration needs with Rite Map Pack: "River Isle”.

This multi-page PDF allows you to print out both battlemaps at a 1 square=1 inch scale as a letter-format map and is also available in a printer-friendly light grayscale version. It also includes JPEGs of the maps with and without grids for use with your favorite virtual tabletop program.

This map originally appeared in Adventure Quarterly #5.

161733.name: 21 More Organizations
161733.description:
From publisher blurb:

21 More Organizations provides 21 new and varied groups from Gypsy Knights Games' Clement Sector setting for use in your Traveller game, each with their own unique history, motives, and goals. Read about groups as varied as The Reliable Starship Escort Service, The Royal Astrographical Society and Harbringer Productions.

In addition, 21 More Organizations also includes details and career tracks for the all-female Alpha Delta Force of Tal'Kalares (Franklin 0105) and the Cascadia Fugitive Marshals Service.

While the book has been designed to be used with our Clement Sector setting, these organizations can easily be modified for use with any Traveller setting.

Like all our products, the main intention of this book is to provide an extra spark to the Referee's imagination.

161734.name: Rise of the Vampire
161734.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mini Quests by Survive RPG offer compelling 2 page adventures that are great for a one-off session, convention play or for use as a side quest to your campaign. Mini-Quests is designed for Pathfinder or other D20 games. In RISE OF THE VAMPIRE the characters must find the hiding place of a resting vampire before sunset - did I mention the adventure was for 2nd or 3rd level characters! Will they surive?

161735.name: The Baron's Bastard
161735.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mini Quests by Survie RPG offer compelling 2 page adventures that are great for a one-off session, convention play or for use as a side quest to your campaign. Mini-Quests is designed for Pathfinder or other D20 games. In THE BARON'S BASTARD the characters must travel into the Dire Swamp and rescue the Baron's son from the vile hag Greyla.

161736.name: Zedkiel's Chapel
161736.description:
From publisher blurb:

Two brave adventurers rescued Zedkiel the scholar on his way home from the tavern. A large bat-like creature had attacked the man and certainly would have slain him had Ulad and Frango not intervened. A month later reports of another large bat-like creature surfaced as several townsfolk were killed one night under a full moon. Ulad and Frango grew suspicious and discovered something horrid had happened to Zedkiel. The man eluded them until the pair of adventurers discovered the strange abandoned chapel Zedkiel was using as a hideout. The characters have a choice to make - seek out and destroy Zedkiel or aid him against the vigilante townsfolk.

A Pocket-Sized Encounter compatible with the Swords & Wizardry rules system for 2nd to 4th level character.

Pocket-Sized Encounters from Iron Tavern Press are shorter scenarios designed to be dropped into an existing campaign with minimal preparation. Use them for shorter sessions, provide your players with choices that won’t derail your campaign or even as a launching point for a new campaign path.

Included in this product are:

New Werebat Monster
Multiple adventure hooks
Location based encounter area map (grid and gridless)
Seeds for expanding the adventure
Rumor Table

161737.name: The Wizardarium of Calabraxis
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
161737.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Wizardarium of Calabraxis starts off with strangely behaving apemen, but players who start to explore the cave where they reside will soon discover there is a lot going on: ancient civilizations, the mad experiments of a forgotten wizard, and a couple unique magic items are guaranteed to provide a lot of bang for your buck to you players. This module has stats for the DCCRPG, but if one wants to work around the weird dice, this module is probably at home in just about any OSR rules system.

161738.name: Dungeon
161738.description:
From publisher blurb:

Modular Kit: Dungeon is a printable dungeon tileset compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone set, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

Modular Kit: Dungeon comprises 40 different tiles that can be printed multiple times and arranged in limitless combinations.

Also included:

A set of 300dpi full size png files, for poster printing or VTT.
A page of dungeon accessories, such as pits, trapdoors and bone piles.




This set is compatible with the 2.5D crafting system, a crafting technique for making dungeon tiles more than 2D but not quite 3D. The 2.5D system was created by DM Scotty (Google his forum for tips)

161739.name: Meltdown and the AlphEx Corporation (Savage Worlds)
161739.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your skin burns as you lunge towards the armored figure. It turns, and a single blow of its lead fist sends you staggering backwards. Its face plate reveals only two glowing eyes. "Sorry pal," it says in a distorted voice. "Nothing personal. I'm just trying to feed my kids."

Meltdown and the AlphEx Corporation is short book that presents a supervillain and several related NPCs for you to use in your super-powered Savage Worlds campaign. It contains not only game statics, but also character backgrounds, adventure hooks, and a sample story arc that demonstrates how to use Meltdown and the AlphEx Corporation as recurring elements in your game.

Meltdown and the AlphEx Corporation includes the following NPCs:

Meltdown: A living radioactive battery who must wear a containment suit to prevent poisoning those around him.
Sebastian Gallows: The power-hungry CEO of the AlphEx Corporation, who forces Meltdown to commit crimes.
Keegan Scott: A former supervillain who now builds high-tech weapons for the AlphEx Corporation..
Dr. Amrita Chaudhary: A mutant with a life-draining touch, who is also a geneticist researching Meltdown's condition.
Enhanced Security: AlphEx security officers enhanced with super suits.
Heli-Drones: Robot helicopters used to assist AlphEx security.




This book requires both the Savage Worlds core rules and Super Powers Companion to play.

161740.name: Lightning Class Fast Courier
161740.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible starship. The ship introduced in this installment of the series is the fast, jump capable Lightning Class Courier.

The PDF contains the background of the ship, statistics for it and its crew. In addition the document contains simple deckplans (Without scale or grid!) of the ship and images showing the ship from various directions.

161741.name: Troglobites
161741.description:
Fingertip Fungal Farming.

In Troglobites, players take on roles as mushroom gardeners in the deep dark cave. Every turn you rummage through the great rubbish heap, bringing home prize mushrooms (or perhaps nasty pests).

Each turn, you are offered 4 mushrooms pieces, picked blindly from the central heap by the previous player. You must choose three to keep and one to discard. Each type of mushroom/pest has a tastiness value, and a placement rule. You are trying to grow the tastiest mushroom garden.
After a player fills the central hexagon of their garden, the game enters the final round, ending when it returns to that player.

The pieces are deliberately textured, and the rules suggest that on the 2nd or 3rd game players should be blindfolded, relying on their fingertips to 'see'.

161742.name: TacDex: Halo
161742.description: TacDex: Halo uses gameplay similar to well-known card game War, with players revealing cards simultaneously to try to claim cards owned by the opponent, but a battle marker determines whether a high or low card wins a particular battle and players each have special action cards to add new twists to the conflict.

161743.name: TacDex: Pirates
161743.description: TacDex: Pirates uses gameplay similar to well-known card game War, with players revealing cards simultaneously to try to claim cards owned by the opponent, but a battle marker determines whether a high or low card wins a particular battle and players each have special action cards to add new twists to the conflict.

161744.name: TacDex: The Walking Dead
161744.description: TacDex: The Walking Dead uses gameplay similar to well-known card game War, with players revealing cards simultaneously to try to claim cards owned by the opponent, but a battle marker determines whether a high or low card wins a particular battle and players each have special action cards to add new twists to the conflict.

161745.name: Front Page Sports: Trophy Bass 2
videogameexpansion: Front Page Sports: Trophy Bass 2 – Northern Lakes
161745.description:
User Summary

Trophy Bass 2 is an excellent sequel that brings the realism of fishing to your desktop. New features include fishing from an overhead view, reel dragging for different classes of fish and a fish radar for finding good fishing spots.

Improve your strategy by using various fishing techniques and an array of bait. Not only can you play on a tournament mode or start a career, you can also compete against up to 7 virtual players in an online multiplayer mode. You may also just spend a lazy afternoon fishing for plenty of casual fun. Whatever you choose, prepare to experience the ultimate fishing simulation!

161746.name: Cog Wars
161746.description:
While Prof Von Neumann's Mechanikal Marvels may be much admired in academic circles, inside his lab it appears these clockwork amobeas are locked in a brutal struggle for survival!

This game is intended for small parties of up to 8, but the game achieves maximum cerebral satisfaction between a pair.

Each turn a player, gentlemen or lady, may place or move tiles that add to their amobea, strengthening, attacking or shielding it from the predations of others. If they were fortunate enough to have overlapped (and thus devoured) tiles of their opponent on the previous turn, their amobea's increased vitality is expressed by the placement (or movement) of extra tiles in this turn.

The game is simplicity itself, but brings to mind the mental challenge faced by two wrestlers of that delicate Oriental sport, Sumo.

161747.name: The Space Merchant of Tamlore
161747.description:
TRADER, MINER, BOUNTY HUNTER, EXPLORER, MANUFACTURER
Choose YOUR own destiny in a galaxy full of possibilities

In 2201 A.D., a routine asteroid mining mission went to the dark side of Saturn to seek out new sources of raw energy to power the massive metropolises of Earth and Mars. They arrived and discovered an ancient alien warp gate floating amongst the chunks of ice that made up the planets' rings. The leaders of Earth activated the gate and sent expeditions to find out what was on the other side. The explorers returned and told tales of new worlds to discover, colonise and exploit.

It is now 2265 A.D and with the aid of the warp gate, humanity has spread out across the galaxy.
You are the sole heir to the wealthy Star House of Tamlore. Your palace resides on a frozen world at the edge of the backwater kingdom of Galsia. You have lived a sheltered life knowing little of the wealth your father created by harvesting the Xerer’s asteroid fields that dominate the planets skyline, and trading the goods the colonies that you govern have created. In an instant, you are thrust into a Universe full of danger and intrigue where you and your loyal protector Fenrix, barely escape with your lives following a devastating attack on your home world by the insidious Star House Greaver.

Now completely alone, you must set out to rebuild what you have lost, and seek your revenge

By using innovative board game mechanics The Space Merchant of Tamlore is the next evolution of adventure gaming!

161748.name: Front Page Sports: Trophy Bass 2 – Northern Lakes
161748.description:
User Summary

Being an expansion to the base game Trophy Bass 2, Northern Lakes adds five additional great fishing spots:
Lake St. Clair (Michigan/Ontario),
Lake Winnebago (Wisconsin),
Lake Onieda (New York),
Mille Lac (Minnesota) and,
Dale Hollow (Tennessee).

What is more, the expansion offers several great new species of fish such as yellow perch, sauger, rock bass, musky, tiger musky and monster pike for an enhanced fishing experience.

161749.name: Trophy Bass 2 Deluxe
videogamecompilation: Front Page Sports: Trophy Bass 2 – Northern Lakes
161749.description:
User Summary

A compilation containing the great fishing game Trophy Bass 2 along with the expansion Northern Lakes.

161750.name: Producer
161750.description: As producers of their own movies in the aptly named Producer, players scramble to hire actors; line up plot elements such as characters, problems, and resolutions; and toss in a few bonus items such as costumes in order to make the best movie they can. They can trade with other players or sabotage those competing productions. The final round starts when the first player wraps, and victory is a combination of cards played and how well each player tells the story of her movie.

161751.name: Selfie: The Game of Silly Expressions
161751.description: In Selfie: The Game of Silly Expressions, you draw a card, take a selfie, then watch as friends and family try to guess your expression. The favorite guess gets a point, and the player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

161752.name: Field & Stream: Trophy Bass 3D
161752.description:
From the Back of the Box

Above and below water, Field & Stream: Trophy Bass 3D brings the ultimate fishing experience right to your desktop. With unparalled 3D details of 15 tournament lakes and over 30 species of fish featuring improved artificial intelligence, you'll quickly immerse yourself in the world of professional bass fishing. Includes enhanced online tournament play so you can fish with or against friends and family from all over the globe.

161753.description:
From publisher blurb:


Can you escape from the House?

While conversing with your associates, the distressed fiancé of your friend, Arthur Reginald, enters. Being long overdue for returning to her, she has become worried. It is uncovered that he planned on exploring the mysterious house of George Walter Michaels, an abandoned property surrounded by superstition and dark rumors, but when she expressed her worry about such an action, he lied that he would join you instead. At the brink of tears, she requests your assistance in locating him before something tragic can occur. You inform her that any ominous premonitions about her fiancé’s exploration of the house are unfounded, but agree to aid the lady none the less.

Upon entering the dilapidated building, you all are affronted by unimaginable horrors that threaten life and sanity. Can you find the right door out, the key to open it, and the means to survive until the break of day to be free from those what lurks in the house of George Walter Michaels?

As a 10 Die Survival Game, the players run through as a group, trying to survive the cards that remove their pile of Dice. If you are out of Dice, you are dead.

This is a game for 1 or more players. You need 10 six-sided dice per player to play, or if 10 dice per player is too much, you will need some way to track the dice that they have remaining – a pad of paper, some counters, etc. – and 10 dice.

The game also requires a deck of 10 Die Survival cards. This deck should normally be comprised of 3 Salvation cards, and at least half of the total deck should have Encounters (see below). A standard size for a deck is 30 cards.

Each player should begin the game with 10 six-sided dice; this represents their life/sanity/etc – when you have 0 dice remaining, you are out of the game.

When all 3 Salvation cards are found, then the game ends. All players that still have dice remaining can pat themselves on the back, while all dead players shouldn't feel too bad for dying to the difficult circumstances that they were thrust into.
161753.name: The House of George Walter Michaels

161754.description:
From publisher blurb:


Those that slumber must eventually wake

A colleague of yours sent you a disturbing note, which ended with the words:

"There is no safety for me while I reside beneath the shadow of the pyramids. I pray that you soon meet me in person after receiving this letter. Otherwise you shall not see me again."

You rushed to his dig in the middle of the Egyptian desert, but you find his camp ransacked and empty. Clutching to the hope that survivors may have fled into the opened tomb nearby, you enter with your band only to become trapped by sandstorms. But you hear sounds coming from somewhere within the dark corridors of men long dead. Is it your colleague or something far worse? And can you eventually find your way back to the Entry Slab, slide it open with the Crowbar, and escape the Tomb of the Damned Pharaoh into Calm Skies once more?

As a 10 Die Survival Game, the players run through as a group, trying to survive the cards that remove their pile of Dice. If you are out of Dice, you are dead.

This expansion introduces new card types - Anxiety and Tool cards - while adding more abilities that pit players against each other in the hopes that they will be the ones to survive.

This is a game for 1 or more players. You need 10 six-sided dice per player to play, or if 10 dice per player is too much, you will need some way to track the dice that they have remaining – a pad of paper, some counters, etc. – and 10 dice.

The game also requires a deck of 10 Die Survival cards. This deck should normally be comprised of 3 Salvation cards, and at least half of the total deck should have Encounters (see below). A standard size for a deck is 30 cards.

Each player should begin the game with 10 six-sided dice; this represents their life/sanity/etc – when you have 0 dice remaining, you are out of the game.

When all 3 Salvation cards are found, then the game ends. All players that still have dice remaining can pat themselves on the back, while all dead players shouldn't feel too bad for dying to the difficult circumstances that they were thrust into.
161754.name: The Tomb of the Damned Pharaoh

161755.description:
From publisher blurb:


Can you Escape from the Island of Fog?

The Flying Dutchman is supposed to be a portent of a ship's doom. Not long after witnessing the legendary ship sailing through the air, a terrible storm runs you aground on an island surrounded by fog. As you explore it, along with abundant amounts of exotic fruit and fish that any rich man would pay to dine upon, you begin encountering the locals: monstrous sea creatures; half-man, half-aquatic abominations; dead sailors. You must escape this once-thought paradise, especially since the island is sinking into the sea!

As a 10 Die Survival Game, the players run through as a group, trying to survive the cards that remove their pile of Dice. If you are out of Dice, you are dead.

This expansion strives to add a little more choice to a player's turn; 16 cards force you to either face an encounter immediately or introduce an effect that will make one or more encounters afterward become much worse; a variety of items also allow for one-time helpful effects.

This is a game for 1 or more players. You need 10 six-sided dice per player to play, or if 10 dice per player is too much, you will need some way to track the dice that they have remaining – a pad of paper, some counters, etc. – and 10 dice.

The game also requires a deck of 10 Die Survival cards. This deck should normally be comprised of 3 Salvation cards, and at least half of the total deck should have Encounters (see below). A standard size for a deck is 30 cards.

Each player should begin the game with 10 six-sided dice; this represents their life/sanity/etc – when you have 0 dice remaining, you are out of the game.

When all 3 Salvation cards are found, then the game ends. All players that still have dice remaining can pat themselves on the back, while all dead players shouldn't feel too bad for dying to the difficult circumstances that they were thrust into.
161755.name: The Abyss of the Lurid Cove

161757.description:
New Salem is a hidden-identity, drafting, deduction, and set-collection game in which players are 17th-century founders of New Salem, where they hope to escape from the pestilence-filled streets of Salem during the infamous witch trials.

Righteous players need to keep the witches at bay and construct specific types of buildings while witches add pestilence to the new town without detection. If the righteous players can keep pestilence at a minimum, the one who scored the most victory points will win, but if there is too much pestilence, the witch who was the most evil will win.
161757.name: New Salem
boardgamepodcastepisode: Dukes of Dice - Ep. 48 - Demi-Spiel
Ep 227 3 Risks to your Kickstarter campaign
Episode 107-- Gen Con 2015 Wrap up and La Granja Review
Overworld Games Interview, Pacificon & more!
RDTN Episode 75 – Feel Like a Number: Codenames, The Grizzled, Mafia de Cuba, New Salem, and Chit Chat
TRCP Launch Episode 4

161759.name: Steamscapes: Gunslinger's Guide
161759.description:
From publisher blurb:

You can keep your gadgets and goggles and machines. The only gear I need is a holster and what goes in it. Now hand me those pliers - I need to tweak the action on this just a touch.

The Gunslinger's Guide is a supplement specifically designed to offer more play options and story hooks to gunslinger characters in the Steamscapes world. It includes extensive setting information relevant to gunslingers and their companions, optional rules for situations a gunslinger may commonly face, and an extensive weapon customization system for detailed exploration of the Gunsmithing skill.

161760.name: Sky Island
161760.description:
Dark Souls have landed on the sky island and are ready to steal all the stars. It's now up to you to defeat the Dark Souls and save the land from their menace. Arrow keys to move. Click and drag the mouse to rotate.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgamehonor: 2015 Lys Grand Public Finalist
161761.description:
The Caribbean islands were once a lawless cove run by merchant marines transporting stolen treasures. When news reached the King that these pirates were amassing great riches, he ordered a cut of their loot.

Now in King's Gold, it's your turn to be a pirate, and you must try to pillage ships and other pirates along the way. How far will you go to deceive the greedy King and become the richest pirate on the coast and at sea? On a turn, the active player rolls the five dice up to three times. If a die shows crossbones, it's locked until the end of the turn; otherwise, a player can roll or leave dice as he wants. After he stops, he takes or loses gold as follows:


1 coin face + 1 cannon: Take this many coins from the box, then place this many coins in the King's pile.
1 coin face + 1 skull: Steal this many coins from the player of your choice.
Coins on all five dice: Take all of the coins from the King's pile.
Skulls on all five dice: Take all of the coins from another player.
Cannon on all five dice: Take all of the coins from the box, ending the game.
