3+ crossbones or any non-scoring combination: Place three coins from your stash in the King's pile.


When all sixty coins in the box have been removed, the game ends and whoever has the most coins wins.
161761.name: King's Gold
boardgamepodcastepisode: Essen 2014 - Blue Orange

161762.description:
Every one hundred moons, members from different tribes gather to sculpt new totems. The totems they create represent the values of their family, village, courage and culture. The tribe that makes the most prestigious totem poles wins the contest...

In Wakanda, players compete to create valuable totem poles, but the value of the poles is determined as much by where they stand as by what's in them. Each player starts the game with three headdresses. Six of eight village tiles are placed in a row, with three of the tiles tilted 90º to show that they're out of play; each tile has a unique scoring rule on it, and that rule will apply for all of a player's totem poles if he acquires that tile.

On a turn, a player first draws one totem pole from the bag; the game includes 21 totem pole pieces: one eagle, two chiefs, three tomahawks, four animal skins, five teepees and six suns. The player then either places one of his totem pole pieces on an available village tile OR places one of his headdresses on an existing totem pole to claim it; in the latter case, he places this tile in front of himself and tilts the next village tile in line (if any) to make it available for play.

Once all six poles have been claimed, the players tally their score based on the rules on their tiles, e.g. score 3 points per animal skin on all of your poles or score 2 points per piece for your tallest pole. High score wins.
161762.name: Wakanda
boardgamepodcastepisode: Essen 2014 - Blue Orange
GenCon 2014 - Blue Orange
The Game Pit: Episode 38 - The Big Essen 2014 Review

161763.name: Godzilla (2015)
161763.description:
User Summary

You play the monster itself against human civilization, as you clear missions by destroying buildings and weapons. The game will recreate the look of tokusatsu special effects movies, including signature tokusatsu camera angles and gunpowder explosions, with the latest graphics.

161764.name: Turbo Drifters
161764.description:
Turbo Drifters is an arcade multiplayer racing game! Are you ready to become the top racer? Press arrow keys to move. Space to drift.

Source: The Developer Website.

User Summary

A simple racing game playable via web browser. You try to beat three AI-controlled cars over a race of six laps (quick run mode) or over a series of three-lap races (grand prix mode). Additionally there is a two-player mode for players sharing the same keyboard. There are 12 tracks in total and four vehicles with different attributes.

161765.name: Railroads
161765.description:
Railroads was designed to be a game about table talk. It's about making deals with other players, riding the rise and fall of various authentic nineteenth century railroad companies. In most railroad board games, one player is one company, and is engaged in pure competition with the other players. That doesn't make for a very social experience. Since players are investors in Railroads, they have the opportunity to benefit from semi-cooperative ventures, while hedging out their allies with other investments.

Additionally, Railroads is not a game about budgets and check books. Money functions as points and are never spent. Stock tokens are played and moved in a simplified fashion that means strategy is emphasized and budgeting is eliminated. Stocks are merely methods of earning money (scoring points) so players can focus on their larger plans.

Players who play alone in Railroads will not do very well. Railroads only gain as much track per turn as there are players in the company. If there is only one player in the company, they only lay one track per turn and will not make a lot of money. However, if you can get one or two people to join your venture, you can double or triple the speed that your railroads grow, turning your fledgling railroad into a geopolitical force to be reckoned with. Just make sure that when the money dries up, you are the first one out.

161767.name: Island Survival
161767.description:
A competitive game where all players compete to be the first off an island by collecting the oars to a raft they have to build. Meanwhile they have to try to maintain resources on the island to stay alive such as food, water and shelter. Players battle it out till one person sails off or everyone else is dead. Can you survive?

Island Survival pits you against your opponents. As you find food, water and shelter you also collect items left from previous castaways that help you survive. In your search for items to survive you will come across pieces of a raft. There are eight pieces in all and as each piece is uncovered everyone must assess their health and pay the price for their missing essentials (food, water and shelter). Once all 8 raft pieces are found, the first person to take possession of both oars is able to sail off the island and win the game. Of course, you can always take your hand made weapons and hunt the other players. Last man standing always gets off the island.

This is a turn-based card game with combat decided by dice rolls and strategic card playing. As you role play one of six unique characters, you will find new ways to survive the island.

161768.name: Skunny
161768.description:
User Summary

Skunny is a side-scroller featuring Skunny the squirrel who is on an adventure to claim a treasure that he knows about from a map found in a previous adventure. Skunny can run and jump much like Sonic the Hedgehog or Jazz Jackrabbit. He must avoid enemies and can kill most of them my jumping on their heads. A level can be completed once 100 keys have been collected and the exit has been found.

161769.name: Killing Floor 2
161769.description:
User Summary

Killing Floor 2 will be the successor to Killing Floor and will have a whole host of new features, characters, monsters, weapons and story.

161770.name: Deutschland: Das Kartenspiel
161770.description:
There are always four cards with places from Germany on the table. Players take turns on placing bets underneath. Bets can be:
- This cities is the northernmost/southermost of the four cards
- This city is far east/ far west of Germany
- This city has the most/fewest citizen of the four cards

Correct bets bring points.

161771.description:
A set of limited edition additional characters that will be made available to all backers and in limited quantities for retail pre-orders:

Fisherman - When you collect any fish, gain an additional fish.

Wholesailer - When buying a building, keep 1 of each good sold.

Noble - At the beginning of the game, look at the top 2 building cards and build 1 of them for no cost. It is worth $0 and 0 VP, and doesn't count towards the 4 to trigger the game end.

Mason - When anybody uses stone to buy, collect 1 stone.

Speculator - At the end of the game, add VP to your total building worth equal to the current market value of stone.

Beggar - When another player gains goods from their character action, you gain 1 good of your choice.

These characters have green names instead of the normal yellow names to set them apart from the characters in the base game.
161771.name: Harbour: Launch Promo Characters

161772.description:
Operation Afghanistan is a solitaire game of Combat during the Soviet-Afghan War. The player assumes the role of a commander of combined forces in Afghanistan. As commander, you are responsible for securing your Area of Operations (AOR) by successfully conducting various military operations in order to locate and destroy the enemy. Although there are many units available to you, they may often times be limited to you by political, logistical or geographical obstacles.

GAME OBJECTIVE
The objective of Operation Afghanistan is to successfully complete a number of missions and destroy enemy forces in order to gain Victory Points (VP) for the Soviet Forces. The player can choose to play a short game (4 Missions), an average game (6 Missions), a long game (8 Missions) or a full Tour (12 Missions). Once all Missions have been resolved (successfully or not) the Player totals his VP and compares this with the Victory Determination Table to determine the level of success.

Operation Afghanistan contains many colorful Unit Counters. Soviet forces include Spetsnaz, Desantnik, MI-24 Hinds, MI-17 Hips, BTRs, BMPs, Automatic Grenade Launchers, Mortars, DsHKs, Leaders and Air Support. Afghan forces include Mujahedeen, CIA trained Mujahedeen, Recoilless Rifles, and Mortars.

OPERATION AFGHANISTAN may be purchased at http://www.berserkergames.net
161772.name: Operation Afghanistan: A Solitaire Game of the Soviet-Afghan War

161773.name: Little Cooperation
161773.description: This game is for 2 1/2 to 5 years old. It is a cooperation game. There are five cute plastic polar animals on one side of a bridge standing on 6 ice cubes and an igloo on the other side. With a chunky die players take turn taking their animals to the igloo before the bridge falls. The die has 3 outcomes: go to the bridge, go to the igloo, remove one ice cube.

161774.name: Světový film
161774.description:
How well do you know the world movies? Dive into the world of successful movies, many of which were crowned with Oscars. This game builds on the great success of knowledge game Český film (Czech movies). There are newly included photos from the movies, so you can remind the famous movie scenes and recall the names of your favorite actors.

In this game you will find 1800 questions from world cinema. Questions are divided into six groups: American films, European and other films, filmmakers, actors, series and photos.

Double-sided game board allows you to play even a party version of this game, where you will also answer questions and perform fun tasks by speaking, mime or drawing.

161775.name: Space Precinct: Police Cruiser Card Game
161775.description:
Card game based on characters in the Police Precinct television series created by Gerry Anderson.

Players aim to win the game by collecting four different criminals first.Collecting these cards is mostly done by the luck of drawing cards you need. There are Police Cruiser cards that allow for a little interaction between the players. In effect, they make people miss a turn.

161776.name: Shaq Attaq Pocket Shot
161776.description:
Nice action game and beautifully designed. It is intended to be portable and the over-sized box houses a neat container. When you open the container you can see the mechanisms. You can stand them up and you have a basketball game, with the net at one end and the ball launcher at the other.

Players can agree a pre-set number of attempts at 'baskets', the winner being the one with the most at the end.

Game linked to Shaquille O'Neal and his picture is on the box.

161777.name: Who am I? No. 1
161777.description:
A group card game based on bible trivia made by Zondervan.

From the directions printed on the back of the deck:
"Two, readers, on taking the Old Testament cards and the other the New Testament cards, read alternately until someone in the group guesses from the hints given the identity of the character. The tow reader idea does away with the monotony of one voice being heard all the time. "

161778.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Tholian Web Organized Play tokens
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game
161778.description:
Guide tokens and Energy web tokens for playing the Tholian Web Organized Play Scenario.

Description from the scenario:
"While responding to a distress signal in an uncharted sector, you quickly learn that it was a trap and find yourself engaged in combat with enemy ships. Unbeknownst to both fleets, your battle has taken you into an annex of the Tholian Assembly and Tholian ships have begun weaving a deadly energy web around your fleets. Your only chance to survive is to defeat your enemy before the web is completed and hope that your remaining ships can escape the powerful draw of the Tholian Web."

161779.description:
This was given out as a participation prize for the Arena Episodic tournaments.

It contains:

1 Alternate Art Planet Token
12 Away Team Tokens
40 Circular Tokens
boardgameaccessory: Star Trek: Attack Wing
161779.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Arena Organized Play Scenery and Tokens

161780.name: Field & Stream: Trophy Bass 4
161780.description:
From the Back Cover of the Box

* Catch over 30 gamefish species including stripers, walleye, catfish and even musky!

* Thousands of rod, reel and lure combinations in the Virtual Tackle Box!

* Career Play gives you a chance to make it into the Hall of Fame and even become Angler of the Year!

161781.name: Black Bass
161781.description:
User Summary

Being an absorbing fishing simulation for the PC, Black Bass offers hours upon hours of fishing fun for fishing enthusiasts of all ages. Grab your line, select your bait and compete in tournaments either by yourself or with other players. The game features a realistic 3D first person mode as well as expert advice from celebrity angler Hank Parker.

161782.description:
Originally released by Fata Morgana in the 1980s, KREMLIN is a European-style boardgame where players compete to control the Communist Party of the Soviet Union.

The Jolly Roger KREMLIN features updated art and better components created in the style of 1930s Soviet poster propaganda. This edition has an error on the board that has the name of the game covering part of the graphics and text on the board.

Kremlin is played for up to ten turns, ending as soon as the Party Chief successfully waves three times at the May Day Parade or when so many politicians are dead or in Siberia that the Party Chief can disband the Politburo and take complete power for himself.

Each turn has phases. The most important of these are the KGB trials (which can send party members to Siberia or the cemetery) and the Defense Ministry's Spy Investigations which can also force politicians on a winter's gulag holiday. With the KGB, the catch is that the higher up the ladder the target, the more difficult to bring down, and Party Chief's tend to change KGB leaders who take shots at the top... For the Defense Minister, his investigations require a trial to be successful--and a guilty vote, and that isn't always possible in the Central Committee.

The catch? Players allot influence secretly at the start of the game and don't reveal it until it is used, meaning no one knows who controls the KGB or any other ministry, not until Influence is revealed--and even then, who knows who still has undeclared influence on that person? It is possible that players can swap control back and forth over the KGB chief even as he is trying to determine who to assassinate!

Once the carnage is done, players have to survive the ravages of aging--and every time a politician takes action, he ages faster than normal...your 50 yr old star of the party? Well, suddenly he's acting like he's 83, Comrade. Life near the top will do that to you. In the Health phase, politicians may die or grow sick--sick politicians can choose to go to the hospital, but while there, they exert no influence and their responsibilities pass on to other politicians. Sometimes this means your man must make the heroic sacrifice to the Rodina and remain on the job even while at death's door.

Once we know who is still alive, the Party Chief is allowed to move politicians between posts. After all, he's in control of the bureaucracy. He can move people up and down, and when he's done, upper ministers do so as well--but can only affect politicians below them on the food chain. Heck, politicians can even sponsor comrades in exile in Siberia to come back to the People. Of course, each person you bring back ages you five years....want to bring back five? Age 25 years in the blink of an eye, Tovarich.

Intrigue cards allow you to take control of situations or foil other players' schemes. In one of the older versions, you could have things like Chernobyl take place in 1920. That's been corrected--so that while events may be the same, they have now been made era-appropriate.

The turn ends with the May Day Parade. If the party chief is healthy, he can wave throughout the day making people happy--clearly our socialist union is prospering. But if he's sick, sometimes he leaves early and is unable to wave, sending doubts through the ranks. If a faction (player) earns three waves, they win the game.

The Jolly Roger version provides three different KREMLIN games in one box.


1: The 'original' with fictional politicians, set in a USSR where KGB investigations send those found guilty to Siberia. This version will have victory conditions based on the original Fata Morgana rules.



2: A version inspired by the Avalon Hill variant titled 'Revolution'. Set in the 1920s, it uses historical politicians as well as fictional politicians. It's a more violent game as those arrested by the KGB are shot and removed from the game



3: A new version, set in the modern USSR and Russia, an era of entrenched bureaucracy and alternatives for escaping KGB persecution. This version introduces the concept of "Going into Exile" to avoid Siberia. It also includes modern politicians from the 1960s onwards, whether it is Kosygin or Putin and Gorbachev.
161782.name: Kremlin (Limited Edition)

161784.name: Poppo Hunter
161784.description:
User Summary
In Poppo hunter, the player sits on a bench and feeds birds in hopes of finding a suitable mate for a pigeon named Popoda.

161785.name: Hog Trivia
161785.description:
Hog Trivia is a game that was created in 1987 and was part of a lawsuit brought on by Harley Davidson, Inc against the manufacture of the game "The Hog Farm". The lawsuit brought forth by Harley Davidson in 1997 stopped all sale and production of the game (even though so few had been produced already, as they were only for sale at "The Hog Farm") an appeal by the owner of the hog farm, Ronald GROTTANELLI, was partially overturned. it was found that The Hog Farm can use the term HOG, but cannot use it in conjunction with items such as this game, effectively ending this board games life span.

The goal of the game is to collect nine t-shirt pieces. At the start of each his turn, the player has to answer a question read from a question card. If he answers correctly, he gets to roll a die and move his pawn the indicated number of spaces forward. If he lands on a t-shirt space corresponding to a t-shirt piece that he does not yet have, he gains that piece.

In addition to the t-shirt spaces, there are penalty spaces which will have some drawback. Among the question cards, there are bonus questions. When a player correctly answers a bonus question, he automatically advances to the next t-shirt space corresponding to a piece he does not yet have.

When a player has all nine pieces and passes the start/finish space, he wins the game.

161786.name: Hissatsu! Center Heroes
161786.description:
User Summary

Center Heroes is a competitive multiplayer action game in which players fight each other to get as close as possible to a target. Periodically, points are awarded to players inside a bounding box and the closest player to the center is awarded bonus points. Various stages include obstacles, traps, and a moving target.

161787.name: Island Viewing
161787.description:
User Summary
In Island Viewing, players drop various items such as banana peals and branches from the clouds using the stylus. These items will affect the manner in which Mr. Cloud moves around an island floating in the sky. A dense fog covers the area and must be explored by moving Mr. Cloud around the map. The goal of the game is to manipulate Mr. Cloud's movements so that he can gather stars.

161788.name: Battle Ground Estate
161788.description:
User Summary

The goal of Battle Ground Estate is to construct bases out of rectangular blocks during the day, and then to defend these bases from alien blob forces at night. Additional workers can be helped out of capsule pods that fall from the sky by enclosing the pods with blocks. These workers help to gather additional blocks to construct the base and will serve as soldiers at night.

161789.name: The Trophy Case
161789.description:
User Summary

A compilation of three Sir-Tech games, each on its own CD. The games are:

Jagged Alliance,
Druid: Daemons of the Mind and,
Realms of Arcania: Star Trail.

161790.name: Spellcrafter
161790.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




User Summary

Spellcrafter will have deep tactical combat and a unique spell casting system. There will be moral choices, side quests, recruitable heroes, and the ability to assemble and summon powerful troops to send into battle. The game will be divided into 3 acts. You will be able to choose from three races.

161791.name: Magrunner: Dark Pulse
161791.description:
Magrunner will put your brain and your reflexes to the test! Magrunner is an original Action/Reflexion game developed by 3AM Games (Frogwares) for PlayStation Network, Xbox LIVE and PC.
Developed on Unreal Engine 3, Magrunner transports players into the near future, where technology confronts the Cthulhu Mythos imagined by fantasy author, H.P. Lovecraft. Magrunner takes us to 2050, at the heart of the Gruckezber Magtech space exploration training facility. This futuristic venture, organized to promote a brand new technology, puts your reflexes and brain to the test, with simple yet exciting mechanics: with the Magtech glove, you can load objects with green or red charges. Two items loaded with the same charge will attract each other, while two items loaded with different charges will repel one another!

Source: The Game Website.
